text: Wow let me explain from the bottom up this place was amazing. We had a wonderful server, great food and a lovely atmosphere. The deserts are to die for. The steak melted in your mouth and the pickles & bacon, big time.

I really wanted to love this place. It was my husband's birthday and he loves steak and apparently Gibbs's is an institution. The atmosphere was something from the 70's, and seemed dingy and dark. While the portions were large, nothing was very tasty. It all seemed like something from a 80's era Sizzler.  My kabob's were cooked to my request but lacked flavor. The Gibby's salad was just a standard salad with a basic dressing, not sure why everyone raves about it. They did provide a huge amount of pickles at beginning of the meal, which my husband appreciated. They also provide a palate cleanser of lemon sorbet (too sweet) between servings.  The recommended wine was barely palatable. Our waitress was kind but she had so many tables to attend to, we hardly saw her. For more than 250 CAD$ I expected delicious and just got ho hum.

First night in Montreal and we were spoiled for the rest of our meals!  
Service was top notch - they had our table reserved and waiting for us even though we were 20 minutes early and they were pretty full.  Waiter seemed to be always around when we needed him for refills, etc...but never really noticed him hovering.
Started off with the Escargot and the Shrimp Bisque - both excellent!  They even brought bread, butter, a jar of pickles and a bowl of fresh bacon bits (really????, however we used them up in our salad and entree sides!).
We ordered the 22oz bone in Ribeye (Medium) and the 10oz Filet (Medium Rare) - both were cooked perfectly.  The Monte Carlo Potato was like a twice stuffed but with extra onions!!!!!
Our waiter made our Martini table side (nice touch) and the wine list had a lot of good selections.
Overall, great experience - staff was really top notch and the food was perfectly prepared!

My family has been going to Gibby's for over 35 years. Even after we moved out of Montreal when I was 6 (I'm 24 now), we continued to make Gibby's our go-to celebration spot. I'm obsessed with Gibby's birthday cakes and with every trip to Gibby's to this day, my family tries to trick me into thinking they stopped doing the cakes. 

When you're seated, they bring over their amazing homemade bread along with my favorite pickles and a bowl of cottage cheese with chives. I could make a meal out of those 3 items alone, but then I'd be missing out on the whole Gibby's experience. 

French onion soup is exactly what it should be- rich broth, sweet onions and lots of golden cheese. Fantastic. 

The salad dressing is some of the best garlic dressing I have ever had. It's so garlicy that they bring you a citrus sorbet (as a child I was really excited about ice cream in the middle of dinner!) to cleanse your palette before they bring out the entrees. 

Steaks are consistently great cuts of meat cooked perfectly. The monte carlo potato it comes with is a nice change from the usual steakhouse potatoes. We mostly order filet in my family, but ribeye and rack of lamb are also great. 

Every trip to Montreal includes at least one visit to Gibby's, sometimes more and I would never have it any other way
The steak is good but everything else from the sides to the desert and service were sub par. Not worth the money or meal in a city with food like Montreal

Normally I like to talk about the food first, which is top notch here. But I must say that my favorite thing on the menu here is a dessert, item. First of all they make their own ice cream here which is one of the best I have ever had. Do yourself a favor and order the crepe jubilee. Homemade cherry sauce with vanilla ice cream rolled crepe. This is the best dessert I have had.

Then not to forget the beef wellington is great here. Just remember they give you big portion size so remember to leave room for dessert.

Great restaurant.

Determined to try all the different steakhouses Montreal has to offer, Gibby's was next on the docket. 

Arriving at around 6 on a Friday night, we were seated immediately. We ordered the clam chowder, the crab cakes, the mustard encrusted steak and scampi on the side. 

We started the meal off with complimentary bread and pickles. Pickles get me every time. Then came the surprise of the night- lemon granita to cleanse the palate! Unexpected, but most welcome. The clam chowder was very good and hearty, plenty of seafood and potatoes. Definitely made my insides smile. The crab cakes on the other hand were a let-down. For 17$, you get 2 small crab cakes with a red chili aioli. The crab cakes tasted like burnt breadcrumbs more than anything. Definitely made my insides sad.

I'm not much of a red meat eater, but according to my boyfriend the steak was good, perfectly cooked to his medium-rare-liking. The steak came with a "Gibby's salad" and a Monte Cristo potato.

The service was impeccable- our server Cynthia was fun and attentive. All in all, I would go back to Gibby's but only for special occasions.

Despite coming on a busy night during Labor Day weekend, we were seated after about a half hour. Large portions. You definitely won't leave hungry. Attentive service, hard working staff. The food was very good, however our steak was cooked a bit under from what was requested. Garlic shrimp and crab cake were absolutely amazing. I wish that there was a more extensive drink menu though. They offer mostly wine. When I asked for a gin martini, I was given gin and St. Germaine in one glass and then a separate glass with grapefruit juice. My boyfriend had a similar "2 cup drink" situation as well for his drink request.

Looking for great food & atmosphere, look no further!!
Situated in Olde Montreal, the decor of Gibbys is wonderful. An olde stone building with lots of history, reminiscent of an olde tavern. The atmosphere is warm w/ a sense of luxury.
We came for 6:00, promptly seated by friendly waitstaff.
Bread, butter, pickles...... & bacon bits served with every meal. Very tasty.
The french onion soup was very good, if I had to nit pick....too much cheese.
Salads were very fresh, crisp lettuce, onions & very nice house vinaigrette dressing. 
In between courses a seldom seen citrus Sorbet, an old classic!
We opted for the smaller rib steak, even the small was at least 16 oz. The Gibbys cut would have been far too much beef.
The steaks were cooked perfect with just enough seasoning not to overpower the flavour.

We recommend Gibbys steak house for great food, atmosphere & dining experience.

Please be aware Gibbys is not a cheap steakhouse, it is worth the visit. A table for 2 could easily spend $250.

Under-seasoned + overpriced = underwhelmed. I've enjoyed my share of excellent steaks at top-notch steakhouses in NYC, Chicago, and other major cities. Dry-aged, prime beef well-seasoned and cooked to perfection...perhaps my expectations were too high for Gibby's, but my wife and I were not impressed with the experience. 

We were seated promptly for our 7:30 reservation on a Thursday evening, given menus, then ignored for 15 minutes. Seriously?  It isn't like they were packed tonight. After finally placing our orders, they brought out a bowl of good garlic pickles, small loaf of bread (nothing special), and 1/2 a stick of butter plopped onto a small searing dish. 

Wife had the gazpacho & I had the Gibby salad, although the anchovies I requested were not to be found; otherwise, both were serviceable if nothing special. 

For dinner, I had the Gibby's rib steak. Totally lacking in salt, pretty clearly not dry-aged - I do better with Costco rib eyes on the grill @ home. Decent ambiance, but no way was it worth the $145 for two entrees + two glasses of wine.
Steak!  Double baked potato, pickles and a loaf of bread.  Not cheap, but it was a great meal.

The service is always fantastic, the ambiance is great.  Started with oysters Rockefeller which were some of the best id ever had. Had the wellington which was cooked to perfection (medium rare). They could give Ramsey a run for his money.  The Monte Carlo potato never disappoints and is well worth all the carbs. If your looking for a place to go look no farther!

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on a Saturday evening. I thought the food was mediocre at best. I ordered the smoked salmon and my boyfriend had the NY steak. I felt like the salmon was over-smoked. I wanted the Monte Carlo potato, and asked to have no bacon added in (I don't eat meat), but the server said the potatoes were already pre-cooked. Kinda sucked. The bread roll was very good, sweet and served alongside with bacon bits, and pickles. They also have an extensive wine menu. It was a busy night when we went- the restaurant was packed, so staff wasn't as attentive to our table. Yummy chocolates at the end of the meal. Overall, we felt the food was fine, but overpriced.

If this is a steakhouse, I am a walrus. Never in recent memory have I ever left more than half of my steak on the plate. I'm not sure what has to be done to remove all taste from a rib-eye but behold this establishment has achieved it! 

If you're a fan of pickles, they come complimentary. If you detest the sight of them, no one will warn you and they will come complimentary anyway.

This restaurant is awesome!! Excellent service, the waitress was extremely friendly and even helped me choose my steak entree. It was absolutely delicious!! Cooked and seasoned perfectly.  The ambience is also to be mentioned. The wood beams and exposed brick give this place a cozy feel. They provide sorbet to cleanse your pallet and their homemade mint chocolate at the end of the meal is a wonderful treat! I highly recommend this establishment. Order the ribeye!

I can't believe the good ratings and recommendations for this place.  For the price I would have expected better service. Save your money for a steak somewhere else (and cheaper, even in Old Montreal!) The only thing I see worth while was the pickles.

1) Too touristy (which is to be expected, but be aware this did not seem to be a 'local' hangout)
2) Service was slow
3) $50 beef wellington - puff pastry was thick and soggy inside yet burnt on the outside (my wife has even cooked it better at home before!) In addition, the filet tasted like medium pot roast even though I ordered medium rare.
4) Waitress took back beef wellington and said that she didn't charge for it, but when the check came, she still charged me for a "salad' for the sides that came with the meal.
5) My wife's rib-eye steak was extremely fatty and lacking flavor
6) Wine was no better that Trader Joe's 3 buck chuck... anyone who knows trader joes knows that their wine is amazing for that price. (Ordered Hardy's 2009 Shiraz/Cab-Sav blend for $32)

Overall the service was bad and the quality of the food was worse that what I can get at the supermarket and make for myself.
it's for American tourists. Not much local individual will show up here. Food is in HUGE portion and had long lost its French spirit.
C'est peut-être mon steakhouse préféré. Le buf wellington est délicieux! Le service est impeccable et efficace.
Steak et fruits de mers... A1

This restaurant is outstanding.  The food is terrific!!!  The atmosphere is warm and comfortable. It is beautiful.  The service was great! My husband had rib eye and I had a Cajun rib eye.  They were the very best.  The Cajun was really spicy. The twice baked potatoes were very good.

We highly recommend this restaurant and can't wait until our next trip to Montreal to go again.

during our stay in montreal we were lucky enough to get a reservation to dine at this wonderful restaurant  the food was hot, plentiful, beautifully prepared, staff was able to answer all questons, valet service, beautiful atmosphere great wine selection
the bisque soup was the best i every had, loved the bread and pickles  sit downstairs for a quiet diner  diner is expensive but worth it  the restaurant is in a beautiful old building    we had steak and fish and both were delicious

I love this restaurant.  I have been here with family, customers and other people from work.  The steaks are amazing.  The Beef Wellington is probably my favorite.  This is a pricy restaurant but it is worth it!  Go with a few friends, take your time, relax and enjoy!

Great steakhouse in Montreal. Amin, our server, was a true professional and gentleman (he cut my daughters steak for her without hesitation). The atmosphere is traditional and the service is professional yet warm. The food, oh the food, still thinking about days later. It's not cheap, but neither are you! So enjoy and spend some time and money on yourself!

Gibbys has a great atmosphere!  We had a very attentive waiter who knew exactly when to come over. They gave very tasty pickles along with a great loaf of bread while you wait for dinner. The Monte Carlo potato side is to die for! I could have had that for dinner alone! Well worth the dining experience!
Lovely and romantic environment, server was very nice. We order steaks. That was very very good. You must try it if you come Montreal

I stopped by Gibby's on my last trip to Montreal and it was one of the best steakhouse dinners I've ever had and for a high-end steakhouse it has absolutely fabulous prices.

The atmosphere is typical old school steakhouse, dark, earth tones, a manly feel.

After taking your drink order the waiter will bring out a bowl of pickles, big pickles. They're on the saltier side but damn good tasting. The waiter also brings out a bowl of grated Parmesan (I believe) cheese, which left me confused at first as it's obviously not meant for pickles.

My drink, a Bombay Sapphire and tonic came out in 2 separate glasses, one with ice and gin in it and another with the tonic water, you mix it yourself from there, which I quite enjoyed.

For an appetizer I had escargot, they came out boiling hot in a wonderful Bourguignonne sauce. Which after eating the tasty little snails I sopped up with the excellent bread they give you.

Your main course is served with a choice of soup, their house salad or some sort of vegetable dish. I chose their house salad, the Gibby's salad. For the life of me I can't remember the dressing it came with but this where the Parmesan comes into play, it goes great with the salad and I do remember that I ate every last piece of it.

For my entree I had the Gibby's cut rib steak, medium-rare of course, with an au poivre sauce because. It came with steamed asparagus (my favorite vegetable with steak) which was cooked perfectly and the best potato I've ever had in my life, they call it the Monte Carlo, it's double baked and has bacon, sour cream and chives in it. It's a little piece of starchy crack. I could have eaten 10 of them no problem but alas I had a beautiful steak to take care of. Speaking of the steak, it was cooked to perfection and amazingly tender and flavorful, same with the au poivre sauce, just perfect. One of the top 5 steaks I've had in my life.

With dinner I originally wanted a glass of Beaujolais-Villages because I'm a fan of very light red wines. The waiter, a prefect representation of a steakhouse waiter (and I mean that in the best possible way) did not agree with my selection and instead advised me to try the Pinot Noir, he was right, it went great with my steak.

And because I intended to gorge myself I got the creme brulee for desert along with a B&B, like the rest of the meal, it was great.

On a side note, the menu at Gibby's is in English however our waiter was definitely a Francophone, there wasn't any problem with ordering though. The portable credit card machine was in French however and because my French is incredibly limited I had to ask for assistance with it.

Gibby's

In an ancient stone convent
Once a hospital 
By the river
Where French is music
To my ears
The beams of wood know stories 
I would like to hear
Of anniversaries and parties
Love affairs 
Fond memories of friends
Waitress almost too tall for the low ceilings
Waiters accommodating and prompt
A family with a beautiful baby
Her older brother carries a toy guitar
A mother who gazes at her son
She is laughing because 
His story, so funny 
Is true

Went there after several years, nothing really has changed. The location is still the prime draw. Menu had a few off the wall mains including shrimp curry with mango chutney, which really is a bit out of place given the average price of mains is $40+.  Server seemed already overwhelmed while the crowd had just begun to file in, and forgot the drinks of two people out of a party of six at the table. Steaks are still the best bet, my filet mignon was perfectly cooked med-rare, but was not as juicy as you would expect for $50 hunk of meat. Monte Carlo potato is overrated, and so is the famous Gibby's salad. Bottom line: if you are looking for overpriced but undersized portions with an underwhelming service in a picture perfect setting, Gibby's is the place to go.

Don't let yelp steer you wrong like it did me.  Was in town and needed a restaurant in a pinch. Found this on Yelp and disappointed doesn't say enough.  Shocking that this restaurant has received so many favorable reviews.  The food was greasy, tasteless, old fashioned, and of low quality.  Not one of the dishes ordered for the table was acceptable.  Both salads were filled with yellow iceberg lettuce.  The shrimp appetizer was surprisingly cooked well but swimming in butter. Beef Wellington was greasy, unseasoned, and extremely over cooked. It is served with a gravy that is most definitely poured right out of jar. Lobster tails were cooked reasonably well but totally unseasoned and tasteless. Lobster tails themselves had no flavor (I'd guess that they are frozen and not fresh). Accompanying the dinners were sides of white rice (Gibby's refers to white rice as Rice Pilaf) and over cooked asparagus.  I suspect the kitchen is run in a similar fashion to a cafeteria rather than a fresh cooking restaurant. 

In a city with so many wonderful restaurants I have no idea how this place still exists.  On top of the terrible food the service was also poor. Our waitress seemed as if she did not know what to do with children at her table and came off as quite rude.  She came by no less than 4 times to "remind" my 4 yr. old to sit down.  As with any child he cannot sit for extended periods of time. He stood in place (holding a conversation not even eating) and this seemed to bother our server immensely. I didn't really think about her constant reminders until a guest at the table behind us leaned in to share that she thought our server was being extremely rude with her "constant hounding of our son".  Regardless, I do not let bad service ruin the night. I am a former chef and when I go out to eat I am there to eat. The food ruined the experience.  This sadly was one of the worst meals I've had out in a while.    

The only positive is the building. Very cool old stone building with exposed wood beams. It is too bad this location is wasted on this restaurant.
Food was delicious, service was great! Had the Rib eye steak tender, juicy, succulent one of the best I've ever had! Would definitely go back if I ever visit Montreal again!!

CAN'T HANDLE STRESS!  Ordered Filet, cooked medium, came well done and very charred!  Then asked to get Beef Wellington, cooked medium, came rare.  Contacted management, and while apologetic, explained that it was a busy night for them.   Far from world class!

Came here to celebrate my birthday. It was recommended by our tour guide so we thought to check it out. It's located in old Montreal. We drove to the restaurant and good thing they had valet because it was hard to find street parking. We made reservations on a Wednesday night. The restaurant is huge! 2 floors. Brick walls, dark lighting. It was pretty loud in the place with it being so big. 

We ordered steak and the osso bucco. The steak was cooked perfect at medium rare. Delicious. We chose to have the salad which was average. They give you bread and bacon bits. In between your meal they give you lemon sorbet to cleanse your pallet. Pretty awesome.  

Now the best thing was that if it is your birthday, they make you an entire cake for free! And then they take a picture of you, print it out, and place it in a Gibbys photo holder. Pretty awesome service for freeing you ask me! Service was so fast and efficient. Definitely recommend the place!

As with the other reviews, they start you off with the pickles, bacon and bread.  Pickles were great but with dinner and wine, a little odd.  Started with the onion soup and mussels.  Both were very good.  Mussels were drenched with garlic, butter and bacon.    Could not stop dipping the bread into the sauce.  Onion soup was classic french onion done well. Ordered the jalepeno sausages and rib steak, Gibbys cut for main course.  The sausages were good not great and the steak was average.  Ended with the gibbys chocolate desert.  chocolate is always good but this was a little different with crunch that reminded me of stale rice krispies.  Some other tables ordered the apple desert that looked awesome.
Atmosphere is what you would expect of Old Montreal and service was very good. Total check was $205 with tip for two people.  We did have a great bottle of Bordeaux  .

No trip to Montreal is complete without dinner at Gibby's.  They start you off with amazing pickles, bread and wine.  The steaks are delicious and consistently cooked to perfection. The menu is diverse, the wine list is amazing and the ice cream stuffed crepes are life changing!!  This is seriously my favorite restaurant in Montreal.

The atmosphere is romantic and old world charming.  The service is fabulous.... even on the busiest of nights.  There's nothing I would change. 

We usually go to Gibby's at least twice per visit to Montreal.  I'm already looking forward to our next meal there!!

We had a wonderful dinner tonight. I had the Beef Wellington. My son had the rib steak. My wife and daughter split a huge piece of Arctic Char. All meals came with a generous salad, twice baked potatoes, sorbet, asparagus and other items. We had escargot and shrimp bisque for appetizers. Everything was cooked perfectly. The service was terrific, friendly but not too over-the-top. We had mentioned that we were visiting Montreal for my wife's birthday and they brought her a birthday cake, not a piece of cake, nor a cupcake, complete with candle. A very nice touch. We left totally satisfied and grateful that we make the trip to Gibby's.
The building is beautiful exposed stone. Although the tables are close together, the room was not too loud and we could talk with the others at our table.
A wonderful experience!

Once again went to Gibby's on Christmas Eve with a few friends as we have done for the past several years.

Food is very good.  Service was good.  We would have preferred to sit in the main dinning room.  That would have made the evening perfect.

Had a wonderful meal and experience at Gibbys during a recent vacation to Montréal.  Needed to call for a reservation and glad we did!  The food was very good - my husband and I each had a steak and twice baked potato, plus the bread and pickles served to the table.  The restaurant is quite large though staffed very well and we didn't wait for anything.  Our server, Linda, made it a fun night and one of the highlights of our trip!

I went to Gibby's for my birthday a few years ago and loved it. They made it so special for me and my friends. So I went back recently with my husband, had the same thing as the first time  (beef Wellington) and it was so awful. The Monte Carlo potato was amazing and thank god it was because it's all I could eat on that plate. Even the starter salad was disgusting, tasted like old leftovers from a dorm room fridge. This place is supposed to be legendary and for the price it should be every.single.meal. Never will I go back to this dated cave with bad beef.

Great place for steak.  A group of us that live in Boston visited Gibbys and found the steak to be as good, if not better, than the high end Boston steak houses.  The prices were similar so this is not an inexpensive place, however the price includes a salad and a side which is not the same as Boston.  We found the sauces to be excellent and tried the au poivre and the bearnaise and both were great.

Atmosphere was great and the waiter was excellent.  We arrived early and the place was full but they had a great outdoor area for us to wait in.  The only issue we had at all was the waitresses and waiters outside never stopped at our table so we could have drinks while we waited.  We tried to flag down one of the waitresses and she said someone would be right with us.  My guess is they were very busy and somehow our table was forgotten.  

Anyone know what you are supposed to do with bacon that they bring out with the bread?

This place is AMAZING!! Would recommend to anyone visiting Montreal. Their Gibby salad is to die for! I had the prime rib with stuffed baked potato for dinner and it was amazing. Decor is very cool and I ta tie, and my service was amazing.

Typical steakhouse atmosphere and decor. In old Montreal which has a quaint area and vibe.

Believe it or not...this is where I had one of the best ribeye. Not just me, people I brought along were quite pleased and we repeated a visit when we came back here again.

Montreal is not exactly known for steak but the Gibby's Cut is juicy, tender and you want to savor every bite. Comes with side and appetizer. 

Cost is comparable to high-end steak in most places but it's well worth it.

Great steaks, great wine, valet parking. 

I've  be been here a few New Years in a row, great family environment right by the fire works by the port of Montreal for the 12 o'clock hour. 

Reasonable high prices, if you compare to NYC or PHL it's in line. But for Canada it's expensive. 

Old chatoe  that is a restaurant. Very rustic but quaint. 

Love the place and excellent food.

Probably the best steak house I've ever been to. Easily beats anything in New York City. The salad was huge and fresh. The beef was seasoned and prepared perfectly. 

The best thing about this restaurant is the service. The staff here are the best I've ever seen. A flawless dinner service for a group of 9.

The building is kept immaculate for a 200 year old structure.Yes, it's pricey but worth it.

Definitely one of the best steakhouses in town. First off, you are given homemade bread and pickles, both of which are delicious. I ordered rib eye steak and it was perfectly cooked. The place is also very nice, keeping the old look to it.
Great service and food.  Had the filet mignon and it was cooked perfect.  The atmosphere was very quaint. Would go back again.
Weird lighting inside, it's kinda of an orange vibe.... but not a big deal because the food is awesome.
Awesome meat main courses, served with side and appetizer, as well as complementary sherbet before the main course and mint chocolate wafers after it. Good service, great food.

Was recommended to us as one of the best steak houses in Montreal.  We ate downstairs, which had a nice ambiance with stone walls, but was very loud.  Not sure if they had the a/c on as it became very warm as the night progressed.  

Good wine selection, especially if you are a French wine fan.  I had the oysters Rockefeller, which were well executed--not too much spinach and breading, which is too often the case at other establishments.  I had the rack of lamb, very nicely presented with mint jelly. Very tender.  My wife had the eggplant parm, which she said was tasty. For desert, she had the creme brûlée.  The custard was perfect, but the sugar topping was not crunchy as it should be.  I had the chocolate desert, which was over the top.  

A little pricey, but not to the point where you question the value.  The place could use a little freshening up in terms of the carpeting.

What a great restaurant. We went there on a Friday night, expecting a wait to be seated and another way to find a parking space. We were wrong on both counts. They have valet parking and we were seated immediately. Our waiter was extremely friendly and knowledgeable, considering my lack of fluency in French. The restaurant is in old town, sat in brick, which of the fashion of the area. The interior carries out the same thing in this relatively large restaurant. Although large, each table achieved a degree of intimacy. A unique feature of Gibbys is the fact that all dishes are served on pewterware. Never seen this before, but it did add an elegant touch. Uniquely, on the table was a bowl of sourdill whole kosher pickles and a small cup of bacon bits.
For appetizers, my partner and I shared mussels Provençal and escargot. The former was outstanding and the latter excellent. We shared the rack of lamb, which was huge. They split the dish for us each receiving four lamb chops. They were just delicious. Even though it was split, each of us was allowed to pick our own side dishes. The baked stuffed potato was a standout. Even though we shared the meal, we were both too stuffed for dessert.
All in all, this was definitely a five-star experience!

Wonderful meal, charming dining room (a bit on the loud side). Service was excellent. Gibby's has a very large wine selection with a wide range of prices. The onion soup was superb. The salad was fresh and served with a homemade house dressing. We had the osco buco and the petite filet with grilled lobster tail. All fantastic. We met some locals while dining there and they told us this is the place to go. I would recommend giving Gibby's a try. Make reservations as the restaurant is very busy.

We absolutely LOVED Gibbys!  The place itself was charming and full of history.  When we first were seated, I did not like the table we were at (we were seated right where you walk in and it was our anniversary and I wanted something a little more out of the way) and asked if we could move.  The staff was excellent and without thinking twice, immediately moved us and apologized. I was very grateful as they were busy and did it with a smile.  Our server was excellent and very friendly...explained everything along the way.  I ordered the Beef Wellington and it was delicious!  I could not believe the size of the filet they give you in this dish. My husband had the Steak Diane and I must admit was out of this world. The cuts of meat were excellent and cooked perfectly. The sauce was amazing. I would highly recommend Gibbys for a wonderful night out with amazing food and atmosphere!

First of all, this is a MUST if you're in Montreal!!
I visited from los angeles and had to stop by. 
Made appointment 2 days in advance for 7:30, showed up at 7 and got seated within 5 mins. Got a great table by the fireplace. Great service! Host/waiters were beey friendly and super helpful! 

Before ordering, we were given some brrad and pickles. The bread was super fresh and tasted amazing!! The pickles were super juicy and tasted great!!
I ended up ordering a rib eye steak gibby style medium rare. The steak was super tender and was topped off with some peppercorn sauce which was super good! One of the best steaks I've tried and was well worth the money. 
Overall this place was great and would recommend it to any steak lover.

i have been eating there for 20 years and i have never had a bad meal. i'm not the biggest fan of steak and yet i still love it there....the chicken kiev is amazing. the rack of lamb is sick....best desserts ever!...and what a great spot in old Montreal and it has valet parking for free...and the staff is super friendly and accomidating

Oldskool steakhouse in old Montreal.  I found it through Yelp and decided to check it out while I was on vacation this summer in Canada.  Yelp did not let me down!

Old Montreal gives the restaurant ambience by location, but when you walk inside, you get the feeling you're in an old place.  You can almost picture folks huddled around their mugs in an old tavern talking about the days' events in the 1800s.  It's dark inside, but also inviting, and the restaurant was filled with boisterous patrons enjoying a fine meal!

The food is classic steakhouse, with very choice cuts and classic styles like Beef Wellington, Steak Diane, Au Poivre, and Bearnaise.  They have chicken (Chicken Kiev too!), and a variety of fresh seafoods and salads as well.

They serve a dish of fresh homemade pickles to every table, and they are fantastic!  Gibby's is a can't miss restaurant in historical old Montreal.  A little pricey, but absolutely worth every penny!  I strongly recommend making reservations beforehand.  I was dining solo, so they were able to find me a little spot downstairs, but the restaurant was very crowded - another indication of a top notch restaurant!

Enjoy!

Friday night dinner... reservations at 8...promptly seated...the bread, bacon and pickles is a nice touch... the Gibby salad was very good and it was a large portion! I had the teriyaki steak with baked potato and my date had the filet and Monte Carlo potato... steaks were Devine! Potatoes were excellent as well. Dessert was key lime pie and Sherbet ... only drawback was the service was a bit slow and the waiter brought my pie but we waited 15 minutes on the sherbet.... in his defense he was dealing with a very large party... all in all highly recommended

Worst steak I've ever had and it was supposed to be a filet. Overlooked. I'm sure there is better food on the menu but the price point didn't meet the quality. Good staff service though and that counts for something.

Rated one of the best steakhouses in Montreal, for what, I'm not sure. I must admit the location is prime: right in the heart of Old Montreal and the restaurant has been there for a very long time. I guess that's why people like it so much. 
1- ordered a half a dozen of oysters, one of them was a bad oyster (could have gotten poisoned). 
2- my bloody Cesar was probably one of the worst I've ever drank. 
3- waiter took 5-10 minutes each time I asked him for something.
4- the fillet minion was ok. Definitely not worth the money. 

It's overpriced and overrated. 2 stars because the valet driver was amazing.

I am not a huge fan of dressy venue dining, but fortunately, I allowed my friends to talk me into eating at Gibby's.  

The entrance to the restarant is through this amazing courtyard enclosed by old timbers and heavy stone.  You are instantly transported to another time.  The dining area is dated, not in a dusty and old way, but in a antique and time-honored way.

The homemade bread and pickles were probably my favorite part of the meal.  I could have eaten a whole jar of the pickles if they sold them that way.  For my main, I had the fish special of the day.  It was cooked perfectly and tasted great.  After reading more reviews, I wish I had ordered a steak and had dessert or at least one of those snazzy coffees!

Gibby's may be considered a tourist trap, but hey, I was a tourist and a good experience at Gibby's left me with great memories of Old Montreal.  I'll definitely be back!

A 17th century structure updated with modern conveniences but still holds an old world elegant flare. Our waitress,  Isabelle, was both knowledgeable and helpful in our selection of wine and food with 36 years of experience.  The filet mignon was cooked to perfection and the Youville rack of lamb (8 ribs!) was simply amazing. Be certain to have the Monte Carlo potato and the Gibby's Chocolate Delight for dessert. The Brazilian Coffee Flambé is both a show and  delicious!

I know Gibbys is a great steakhouse, but when I went I was in the mood for fish. The swordfish was awesome, and I also tried the salmon which was out of this world! I started off with the oysters, which came with a side of horseradish and cocktail sauce, which I also highly recommend. By the time dessert came I was stuffed, but saved room for the complimentary chocolates! Aside from the great food, the service and decor are great!

This is an expensive restaurant, but I highly recommend to go if you are visiting and/or you are a meat lover. 
We went for dinner in a Friday night, we booked 3 hours before so I cannot complain about that. We didn't have the best table, but the ambiance inside is very good wherever you are sitting. The restaurant is very cozy and warm and you really feel like back in the days when you are inside.
About the food... I'm a steak lover, so when we arrived and saw the menu I was pleased to see that many options. The rib steak "gibby's cut" is amazing! I loved it and it was perfectly cooked. The portion was huge and the sides complements were also well served.
We ordered creme brûlée for dessert and it was also not disappointing at all.
The menu appetizers looks good as well, but if you are having a steak do not order anything extra or you will not finish everything.
Service was not the best, but in a Friday night there're not too many restaurants that can offer excellent service; it was not bad at all, but for the price you're paying, of course you expect an excellent service.
This is my best recommendation for a steakhouse in Montreal so far, I will definitely come back!

I wish they had a place like this in DC! It's tucked away in old town; the restaurant itself is sort of in the basement. Surrounded by old grey stones, like a crypt; up on the first floor they have this regal bar. Looks like something of out the Godfather set, with maroon leather chairs, and heavy oak tables. Has a great selection of beers including some local brews.

 Once you make your way down to the dining hall, don't try to count calories or (Canadian) dollars, and just go with the recommendations. They whipped out this great baked mussels dish. Loaded with butter and garlic, they had these enormous mussels actually baked into a clay dish. Then I got the Dore Amande, Canadian wall-eye, baked with a side of potatoes and greens. Simple as can be, but damn good. I think it was combination of how they probably poached it half an hour before and what they seasoned it with (and probably because they poured loads of butter on it). Chasing it down with sauvignon blanc.

 Risking not being able to walk to the taxi outside, I couldn't resist their chocolate cake, and had to obviously pick a nice single malt to wrap things up.

All in all, if you're in Montreal, don't miss out on Gibby's.

OMG... The lamb... the lamb... the lamb... Shared a large sirloin steak and took a chance on the lamb... holy sweet Jesus... the lamb stole the show. The portion is ridiculous as they gave 8 pieces and it was juicy, tender and delicious. It was perfection along with the mint jelly. The great thing about Gibbs's is that the sides are included. So you don't have to spend another $8-$12 per side like most steak houses that are comparable. 

If you don't understand my post... get the lamb!  :)

Great food. Great ambiance. Had the oysters, nice and fresh. Onion soup was excellent. I got the rib eye, wife got the Wellington. Can't go wrong with either. If you are in old town, highly recommend!

I wish I could give this restaurant a better review, but sadly I cannot.  As a Gibby's patron for the last 30 years, I have always enjoyed my experience immensely, but I will not be returning to this once revered Montreal establishment. 

Our party waited over 45 minutes after our reservation time to be seated, and the host was incredibly rude, blaming us for not checking in with him, when we had gone to see him 3 times prior to being seated.  Several other patrons had been waiting 30 minutes past their reservation time as well.

The manager unfortunately did not help matters.  Recognizing the issue at hand, he offered complimentary drinks or dessert, but his demeanour quickly became highly offensive when after providing the drinks, he said "Are you smiling now? Give me a smile." 

That said, the food and wait staff have always been and continue to be exemplary, but the host and manager have been enough to dissuade me from ever going back to a family favourite.  Very disappointing.
It was a very delicious! Really enjoyed the time with my friend there. Nice decoration!

One of the best places in Montreal for steak and seafood.
Quite and elaborate menu that you can't go wrong with.
Escargot, salmon and beef Wellington were good choices.

A great wine selection that goes well with the food.

Don't miss out and treat yourself to fine cuisine !

Magnificent meal and a pleasing environment.  A noise level in the main dining room that is a tick louder than I am used to in an establishment such as this, but all you do is lean in a little to hear your dinner companion.  With that out of the way...I saw the Wellington and Monte Carlo mentioned here on Yelp often so I knew what I was having before we were seated (recommend calling ahead as we did).  The meal was all I could imagine along withe the pickles and fresh bread and a Gibby's salad.  My date started with amazing half-shell oysters and went for a clean plate with a baked potato and the filet (unless you have a hollow leg do not be ashamed to get the petite cut because the standard entree is abundant).  Had to go all-in with Creme Brulee for her and Coupe  Dame Blanche  (a sweet hot fudge sundae w/ vanilla ice cream we call it back where I come from).  This is a meeting spot for families and groups looking to celebrate and quiet pairs like my girlfriend and I (but tonight there were more of the former); so I wouldn't call it romantic.  But the surroundings are warm and the staff is skilled at what they do best and really keep things moving well (but not rushed).

Gibbys used to be our go to steakhouse spot in town whenever there is an occasion or friends/family visiting. The quality of the meal dropped significantly over the past few months...would not go back...

I went here awhile ago while on a business trip. Locals recommended the place, so I felt like I couldn't go wrong. It's like a hidden gem in Montreal; if you didn't know to look for the tiny Gibby's sign on the door, you would literally walk past the place. This restaurant defines luxury: phenomenal service, sumptuous food, and a warm ambiance. Steaks are king here, but the seafood is equally as good. I will definitely return during my next trip to Montreal.

Loved it! Went for annniversary dinner with friends on a trip to Montreal. Our steaks were cooked to perfection unlike some of the other reviews have said. Medium rare & delicious. The atmosphere is not upscale but it is very Old Montreal. Our waitress, Linda, was an absolute delight who guided us to moderately pricd wine rather tha nudging us toward a more expensive one. Even my vegetarian husband was satisfied with his eggplant dish. 
Not cheap but hey, it's Montreal!

Food and atmosphere was excellent! Loved he pickles, bread and bacon to start with. We both got steaks (I got the Wellington) and we were both impressed except both found the food lacked a little seasoning. Still would definitely recommend this place to anyone and just suggest you add a little salt!

Gibby's would certainly fall into the category of "fancy" dining options.  This is a not a casual place, so no sneakers and shorts please you filthy begger; you must dress properly for this special evening.  

  The building itself is positively gorgeous, and was built in the 18th century.  I love the iron gates and the beautiful courtyard, and the stone interior transports you back in time to a period over 200 years ago......very romantic.  Women love this place, hearts swoon, certainly a good option for us guys to bring a special lady.  Most importantly, the food is quite good.  But what the hell is with that little bucket of pickles they bring you?   I dont get that.  I do, however, very much appreciate the sorbet served between courses to help refresh the palate.  Always a nice touch. 

In closing I'd highly recommend Gibby's for a romantic or special evening, and you can touch off your night with a moonlit walk through the cobblestone streets of Old Montreal and stroll along the waterfront.  With a simply magical night such as this, how could you not get some?

My husband insists that we eat at Gibbys every time we go to Montreal.  His family, both American and Canadian have been patronizing the restaurant for at least the past 50 years. According to my husband, it is one of the few primarily English establishments in Montreal. 

The atmosphere is cozy, the wait staff is professional, and the food is consistently good. On our last trip, I got a  fish dish (it was just okay), my husband got the lamb and our friend got the rib eye. Both were raving about their food the whole dinner. This is definitely a red meat type of establishment. 

And save your appetite, the portions are large and the bread they serve beforehand defies description. It is incredibly fresh. 

I read some reviews where people were confused by the bacon bits on the table with the bread and pickles... I finally found a use for them. Great to add to your baked potato side and salad.

The salad dressing is one of my husbands favorites, and is luckily available by the bottle now.

This is a great place to go in Old Montreal if you are looking for somewhere cozy on a frigid Canadian night.  After eating here every time we go up, though, I'm tempted to try something different next time...

I was convinced by the waiter to get the Arctic Char instead of the Salmon.  This morning, I've just thrown most of it back into the ocean.
The service was actually very nice.  The couple next to us was celebrating an anniversary and they gave them a free cake!
The waiter offered to take the fish back when he realized I didn't like it.  I decided to keep it because I know it is a healthy fish, and because I didn't want to hold up my husband's meal, and I didn't want to wait myself for a whole new meal.  I didn't realize I'd still be repeating it this morning.

I do not enjoy visiting a steakhouse frequently for a health reason since quite some time ago, but if someone asked me what's my favourite place for a steak in Montreal, I would've picked Gibbys without the experience tonight. Gazpacho was really not good so I couldn't finish even a third; Beef Wellington was rare when I ordered medium rare (but still good one!); Gibby's cut rib steak was in much lower quality than before (better at Baton Rouge if I may); Monte Carlo potato was bland but salty; Rockefeller oysters were bitter (having assumed that they put too much liquor into the sauce or cheese), so we returned those and had the fresh ones but they were pretty much the same.
After the waiter was told that our last time visit "together" was a year ago, his manners became changed and kind of rude/condescending thereafter. What a strange guy. Gibby's service couldn't be better before if I remember correctly. Too bad. 

Compared to the previous experiences, only the decor (&servers' uniform) is still lovely. (still nice service at Valet parking, and classy ambience though)
So,,I'd rather go to Moishes or other excellent restaurants, believing now people's saying "overrated." Always feeling disappointed to see a favorite restaurant change.

Gibby's is a very cozy steakhouse in a great location in old Montreal.  I stopped in with a group of coworkers and had a very pleasant experience.  The service was friendly and extremely professional.  This is probably the norm for steakhouses of this caliber, but I don't typically eat at places this fancy.

I ordered the "petite" filet-mignon because I wasn't feeling too hungry, and that turned out to be one of the best decisions I've made in a while.  It was still a very large piece of meat and  I struggled to finish it.  A few of my coworkers got individual steaks that could have fed a family of four.  We also ordered a few bottles of wine which were all very good.

Overall it was a good experience, and given its proximity to my hotel, I would likely return again.

If you're cost-conscious, just share an entree with someone because Gibby's portions are quite big.  So there's no excuse to skip Gibby's if you're in Montreal, no matter the budget.  Everything we've tried are good (lobster tail, gibby's cut, lamb chop, nova scotia lobster).  Bread always taste fresh and goes great with the optional bacon bits and pickles that are also on the house. The potatoes, salad and asparagus that accompany the entree were always great.  

Gibby's cut makes steaks from other Montreal restaurants look like a joke.  The difference is unmistakable.

I'm from the states, so I'm not sure the standard for Canadian steakhouses. I'll make the review short, and say that while the food was good, it was nothing spectacular, and I'm not sure it was worth the price. The service was good, the ambiance was okay. Honestly, Morton's is just as good or better.

This place was packed - strongly recommend reservations.  Host was very accommodating, estimated seating at 30 minutes but didn't even have time to order drinks in the lounge before a hostess sought us out to be seated.

Lounge: restaurant was filled to capacity, but only a few people in the bar area.  Dim lighting, comfortable seating by the fireplace, rustic stone walls and rough hewn timbers spanning the ceiling.

Tables in the restaurant are very close together, and atmosphere is loud. Same rustic look throughout.

Service was quick, bordering on brusque. Food promptly served and quick transitions between servings.

Lobster stuffed fillet was perfectly cooked and with just the right amount of lobster.

Wellington fillet: cooked on the rare side, very thin puff pastry wrap and delicious gravy.

Monte Carlo potatoes: twice baked - the way to go.

Bread served before meal with butter and chopped bacon in a dish.  Milk bread? Incredibly fresh and smooth texture.

Chocolate cake, get it with some port.  Definitely big enough to share.

Gibbys is as great a steak house as they come. Located in the heart of the old port you get an amazing feel of the older part of town. If arriving by car you are greeted by valet who handles the hassle of locating parking in this area. The main entrance is beautiful courtyard and a rustic wooden door. Wherever you are seated you'll get this great warm feeling as the atmosphere of the restaurant sucks you in. My go to order is the fillet mignon with Dianne sauce. I have never been disappointed by this cut and always have it cooked just right. For dessert a flambé coffee is the way to go. If you still have room you can grab any dessert or simply munch on a mint chocolate in the shape of the iconic gibbys door. Worth the splurge every time !

I love this place so much; I think it has to be one of the Crown Jewels of Montreal. The ambiance, the service, the food, the personal touches, the quality, all excellent.

This was our second time here. Their bread is so delicious, kind of like pretzel bread, and they also give you some tasty homemade pickles, and even a little dish of fresh bacon bits. What more could you ask for? Fresh bread dipped in bacon bits? Yes, please. We (two of us) ordered some French onion soup to share, it was cheesy and delicious. We also ordered a ribeye to share with their Monte Carlo potatoes, and it was more than enough for both of us. Their ribeye is cooked perfectly at medium rare, with an excellent crust, perfectly marbled, garlic & spices in abundance, and no shortage of juicy flavor. Their house salad is great, throw some of those bacon bits on there too along with their house garlic croutons. If you don't have room for some of their delicious creme brûlée, don't fret, because you can satisfy your sweet tooth with a bite of their complimentary homemade dark chocolate with a hint of mint and the perfect balance of sweetness. Their wine list is to be envied by most places, particularly their delectable Bordeaux available by the glass that pair perfectly with any steak. 

This place is a MUST VISIT in Montreal.

Great restaurant. The food was excellent, staff was helpful, nice and courteous. Although I was there with somebody who spoke fluent French  the staff was very nice to us who spoke English and were glad to speak English as well. My steak was excellent and the deserts were amazing. The building is a very historic spot and near St. Mary's Cathedral.

We ate here this past weekend for my brother's bachelor party.  We wanted to go to a steakhouse one night, and our hotel concierge recommended Gibby's to us.

We were a large group (22), so we sat in 3 separate tables next to each other, which was fine.   The decor is nice and old fashioned.  Our waitress was funny and nice, and we received excellent service from her.

I ordered the rib-eye steak (Gibby's cut) and the Monte Carlo baked potato.  Both were delicious.

However, there was one extremely disappointing thing about Gibby's that prevents it from getting a five star review. The total bill (including tax and tip) was about $2700.  We asked the waitress if we could have a round of Jameson shots on the house as we paid the bill.  She said she had to ask the manager - she returned and informed us that our request was declined.

When you spend $2,700 on dinner, I don't think asking for a round of shots on the house is unreasonable.  The previous night, Weinstein and Gavino's gave us a free round of shots without us even asking, and our bill was significantly lower than $2,700.

Bottom line: the food was excellent and so was our service, but the management is low class.

YUM YUM YUM is really all I need to say about this place! Classy, delicious, and fun. It can get pretty crowded, so reservations are needed, especially on weekends. Their baked potato is a MUST try....and needless to say of course, their steaks are fantastic!
Atmosphere is great. The service was impeccable. Our steak was a little drier than expected.

Delicious HUGE portions and wonderful wait staff! We also got the Brazilian coffee flambé, which was so cool so watch them prepare, delicious, and very alcoholic! Could easily share the coffee and entrees between two, but why would you when the prices are so reasonable!? Highly recommend!!

Gibby's is a great place to visit and dine if you are in Old Montreal area. Be sure to make reservation. I hear that the restaurant used to be a place for locals, but after visitors invaded the place. It has attracted more tourists. The place is loud and full of fun energy. The FOOD..yum. steak is cooked to perfection. As many reviewers agreed, the twice baked potatoe is quite good. I had the lobster tails entree (3 tails) and leftover to take back to hotel for lunch the next day. 

Gibby's, see you on our next visit ! 

P.S. casual attire. We wore shorts, t-shirts and sandals. 
P.S.S. bring a fat wallet !
Fantastic restaurant with great service! How can you go wrong when you start out with pickles! Excellent fine dining! Expensive! 400$dinner!

Hotel booked us a last minute table after a mistake at other restaurant. We were sat right away even a bit earlier than we expected. They start you off with pickles, bread and a bowl of bacon bits. We both ordered the onion soup it was very good. Gibby's house salad was just ok. I ordered the beef Wellington medium rare one half of it was completely raw and non edible. Wife ordered the Gibbys rib medium rare  it was huge and a bit over cooked. The monte cristo potatoes were very good. Portion size was large so even if the temp control was on point we would never of finished the meal anyway. We saw almost every one walk out with doggie bags. Maybe a Saturday night is not the best time to go with them being so busy they can't get one tables temps correct.

Gibby's was so fantastic that we went there two nights in a row during our recent stay in Montreal! While the place can get crowded and the atmosphere can get a little loud, the tables are large enough and far enough apart that you don't feel too constrained. The building (inside and out) has a very old-world feel - lots of stone and wood and fireplaces. It was very warm and welcoming.

But the food is where Gibby's was really perfect. Let's start with the bread - amazing. A hot loaf of pretzely/sourdoughy bread arrives at your table with lots of butter, pickles and bacon. Very fine. I was tempted to ask for a loaf to bring home with me. Our meals (I think all meals?) came with a salad-like starter option. We picked the regular salad option (although there were others), and the salad was plentiful and had a very delicious and light dressing. After the salad, we were given little cups of lemon sherbert, which was light, tasty and the perfect amount. 

The entree was incredible. Both my husband and I had the petit filet mingon, which was cooked perfectly, topped with garlic and herbs, and accompanied by mouth-watering, burst-of-flavor-in-your-mouth asparagus stalks and (we chose) a plentifully large baked potato. The filet was as easy to cut as butter and melted in our mouths. It was definitely one of the best steaks I have ever had and, while we didn't take anything home, they certainly didn't skimp on the portions. 

We finished up with the chocolate mousse which (again) was plentiful and mouth-wateringly good. With the bill they also give you some mint-dark-chocolate squares, which were a nice treat. 

The service was excellent. Our waiters were professional and answered questions. At the end of the meal, Gibby's (like other restaurants we saw in Montreal) settles your bill right at the table with a hand-held electronic system which is fast and easy. Overall, the experience was great from start to finish, and I'm so glad Gibby's was recommended to us.

We are tourists in Montreal for a few days. My wife wanted a steak and Gibby's was listed on the hotel restaurant list. We were a little concerned about what would be acceptable attire since we were running around the port all day and didn't even bring dressy clothes. At Gibby's, you can go and be comfortable in shorts & a golf shirt (like me), jeans, dressed up or anywhere in between.

The building and decor are phenomenal, even if you show up without reservations (like us) and upstairs is full...downstairs is really nice also!

The wait staff were very professional, but would read the tables and be goofy / humorous if that was how your party was. We had Michel as our server and his interactions with us and busting my 14 year old son's chops was wonderful, but all still with superb service. The food was great; two of us had Chicken Kiev which was really good, one Beef Wellington which was cooked to perfection and very tasty, and one teriyaki steak which was a thick, juicy and perfectly prepared medium. Deserts were also outstanding!

This restaurant is not cheap, but compared to lower quality places nearby, the slightly higher price is well worth it since you get such a higher quality meal and service. 

Kudos!!
This a good place to eat a grill lobster.  The portion are big and good quality.  The restaurant can also be crowded and a little loud. Good place.

Absolutely amazing. I had the fillet mignon Wellington and the Rockefeller oysters as an  entree. Wine can be ordered per glass, at a very reasonable price. The total is expensive, but you are well stuffed with amazing food. The only downside is that it's quite expensive. My bill came to $300 with tip, for two.

Probably one of the best steakhouses in Montréal. My friend and I were visiting briefly and heard of Gibby's through a work colleague. 

When we arrived, we were surprised to see how hidden away it was. But we were even more delighted by the inside decor.

The staff's service was above board and the food was out of this world. I had the New York Sirloin (16 oz) which was huge and excellent and my friend had the most tender lamb ever.

One of the best. Go here.

Really good steakhouse, friendly waitress...but the thing I will always remember about Gibby's is the cozy atmosphere.  Apparently, the building is over 200 years old and was formerly used as a stable.  The building is made of stone and there are wooden pillars all around.  It reminded me of a medieval garage.  I imagine it would be the perfect place for dinner on a cold Montreal night.  Definitely a one of a kind place.

As I work through my way of trying the best steak in Montreal this has remained the king. Suggest to get the Gibby's cut rib steak. Massive but so good. Unlike other steak houses that char the outside, they grill it properly. The bread, pickles are great as is the salad. The twice baked potato is quite delicious. Didn't like the beef sausages but who cares it's about the beef. Creme Brule was and still is one of the best I've had. 

Ambiance and service are both great.  Highly recommend going to anyone with the means.
Not enough can be said for both the quality of the food and service at Gibby's.  Fresh seafood, great steak and good wine selection.

Very nice steakhouse. Expensive but you get what you paid for. Ambiance and decor is definitely old school, maybe a bit more crowded than I'd like with most of the way the tables are laid out, but we were a large party and sat towards the back in a slightly more spacious area. Steak was excellent, cooked perfectly. Pretty good drink selection too from beer to wines and also a full liquor bar.

One of my favorite steakhouses.  GREAT wine list.  Classic : soup, salad and STEAK.  Great desserts too !  Nice ambiance walking through the cobblestones of the Old City into the stables....arrive at Gibby's.  I think a Montreal must.  I gave it a 4, I see lots of 5's..... it's not the best in the CITY, but absolutely overall, a wonderful evening......and I am a foodie....................

Met some friend's here during the Grand Prix Weekend. The place was popping! Got here around 7:40 for our 8 PM reservation. They had the table ready and seated us on the spot. Ordered some drinks and a few appetizers. I had the escargot and they were perfect! For dinner I went with the swordfish that was fresh and delicious. My wife had the rib eye and it too was fantastic. Great flavor! It did seem kind of weird that the whole upstairs lounge looking area was empty. You'd think they would get a bigger kitchen and some more staff and fill that place up too when big events are in town.

In any case it was delicious and the decor both in and out was very unique. Get a reservation on the weekends though because this place was BUSY!

Service was borderline passable.  Nothing spectacular for the price, but nothing to really complain about either.  Standard bread and pickles on table to start off but if you want pickles bread and coleslaw go to Moishes especially for the after 9 specials..  
Started with a salad which was extremely disappointing and kind of insulting.  it looked and tasted exactly like the pre shredded lettuce bags I get at Loblaws.  The sauce, despite the waitresses claim of being fantastic and popular no better than what is found in the grocery aisles.  
I ordered mignons of beef diane which was good.  Perfectly cooked rare, but both the sauce and steak tasted too buttery, and suggested wine pairing with dinner wasn't a hit and didn't go well with the mushrooms and sauce.  If I could have gone back I would have saved myself a few bucks and pick something cheaper as this was not a $50 dish.
All in all, I left somewhat disappointed as the food was nothing exciting, and nothing I can't get elsewhere for cheaper.  I don't mind paying a premium on food prices if justified with a nice setting or top notch serve such as Queue de cheval  and it was nice eating in the old port environment.  I'm glad I was dining with some friends and total damage was around $90  instead of ~$200 if I was with my fiance, at which point I would have left absolutely disappointed and annoyed.
This restaurant is expensive but so good! The pickles and fresh bread are delicious, and everything i've eaten there was good. Meals come with soup or salad - salad is a good pick!

This is an old school steakhouse, so forget about a contemporary decor or an innovative menu, but if you're in the mood for a steak and a baked potato, this is the place to go. The food and service are top notch and it's a bargain compared to some of the other high end steakhouses in the city.

Place was just OK. Nothing spectacular, nothing bad. But I'm not coming back.

Should have avoided the place after seeing the tour bus stop up front. Maybe it was the crowd but the place was really noisy. Don't expect to be able to have a conversation unless you want to shout.

Food was a bit overpriced. We had steaks and fish. Fish wasn't the most fresh. Steak was ok. Better places and better value for money at places down the street.

Cut to the chase - Gibbys cut rib steak was charred to perfection. It definitely had the soft crunch texture on the outside and tender on the inside bite. I normally go medium rare plus to medium on non dry aged cuts, especially ribeye, where the fat melts into the meat a little more. It's simple and flavorful. 20 oz bone in so go easy on the apps as the portions are of a bonafide steakhouse. 

The Monte Carlo potato was a big win with the steak. Essentially twice cooked mashed potato stuffed back into the skin. 

The dining room had all the steakhouse charm with a quaint touch of Old Montreal. 

Bread & pickles for the opening is pretty good too. 

Overall great steakhouse experience. The best of the best in Montreal. A plus for being in the quarters of Old Montreal ideal for casual family or a impressive date.

I loved this place! This was one of the best dinners I have had in months. 

This place is old fashioned and reminded me of the type of steak houses my grandparents used to take me to as a kid. 

I love the value for the amount and quantity of food they give you. 

I had the mustard rack of lamb. The lamb tasted great and was cooked perfectly. The entree came with a delicious fresh salad, the monte cristo baked potato which was delicious, and perfectly cooked fresh broccoli. 

I had a bit of my friends rib eye and it was one of the best steaks I have had. 

The homemade chocolate dinner mints at the end were a nice touch. 

This place does dinner right and it tastes amazing. I'm making another trip to the city soon just to eat here again!

It's warm, it's cozy, it's inviting. Gibby's is one of Montreal's oldest, finest and classiest steakhouse restaurants. It's hard and very rare to walk out disappointed, which has never happened in all my experiences there. It's worth every penny, and in my opinion, is ideal for the older crowds, a family get together, or celebration.

Menu favourites: Clam chowder, rockefeller oysters, crab cakes, filet mignon of beef wellington, lobster.

Topped off with my favourite desserts: Hot apple croute, and crepe jubilee

Bon appetit :)

My dining staple in Montreal for sure.  Everything is simple, done simply, and done perfectly.  The steaks are perfect, the fish fresh and well-prepared, and if you like sauces on your food try the seafood crepe or the beef wellington.  The Gibby's salad which comes with the meal is fresh and tasty, and the sorbet intermezzo is a nice touch before dinner.  The wine selection is good and vast.  And the ambience , in a centuries old stone cottage is quaint and pleasant.  There are other places more fancy and more famous in Montreal...but I find myself eating here at least once a week when I am in Montreal.

Vibe = ehh... sort of crate and barrel-esq which isn't what we expected. Steak was good but seafood wasn't as good. Service was amazing. They had our table ready immediately, we didn't like the corner they put us in and they were happy to change us to another table. Our waitress Nancy was amazing. She made us feel so special as we were there to celebrate my moms birthday. She brought a cake and took a photo of us which they printed and gave us at the end of the night. Overall great experience.
Excellent food and excellent service. The room was really nice. Portions were a little bigger than I'm used to, so a little hard to walk out. Highly recommend this place

We love Gibbys.  This came recommended from a friend in Florida. Our family of three includes our 15-year-old teenager  We all had a wonderful meals including the teriyaki steak and the lamb chops. The salad and the appetizers were also fantastic. You cannot go wrong going to Gibbys

Gibby's is without a doubt as good as it gets. Not only as a restaurant, but also as a life experience.

The restaurant is unapologetically unhip, rustic, and old-fashioned. From the minute you are escorted your table, it is clear that you are a VIP guest being closely looked after. Virtually everything served is made in house. They do not cut corners here and for their efforts they are rewarded with endless customer loyalty.

Upon sitting, you are immediately served with a loaf of delicious home baked bread that is still hot and has the consistency of pastry. Spread with butter and the complimentary homemade bacon bits, it's like biting into the forbidden apple in the garden of Eden.

You are also supplied with a never ending supply of dill pickles as well as full fat cottage cheese with chopped green onions (upon request). Up to this point, there is no charge for anything listed in this review.

Pair the free bites with a stiff drink or three and you are already well positioned for a great evening. Then comes the famous Gibby's salad included with every meal. It is a fairly simple salad composed of mixed greens and tomatoes. Where it excels however is with the addition of the homemade garlic dressing, homemade croutons, fresh cracked pepper, and anchovies (on request). 

After a few slices of the bread with butter, bacon bits, pickles, and salad, usually someone at the table will say that they are full and don't even need a main course. Ignore these people for surely they are deeply unhappy and damaged. They might even be a danger to themselves and the public.

The steaks here are both humongous and divine. While they don't get the same level of caramelization on the crust as some classic American steakhouses, they do come with spices and chopped garlic upon request and are usually cooked to perfection. From memory, they have 2 sizes of filet mignon, a gigantic sirloin, and the mighty ribsteak. Other spectacular dishes are the rack of lamb served in the classic style with classic mint jelly, shish kebab, and beef Wellington. 

On the seafood side, their butterfly shrimp is spectacular. You are served with about 8 or 9 huge butterflied shrimp which are lightly dusted with garlic breadcrumbs and served with garlic butter. They also have lobster tails, and fresh fish which is well prepared....but seriously, don't ruin your life by ordering the fish. We're here for a good time, not a long time.

Each meal is also accompanied by a side. Gibby's signature side is the Monte Carlo potato which consists of a twice baked potato prepared with sour cream and bacon. It is outstanding and actually goes well with the garlic butter or mint jelly if you happen to have them on your plate.

Desserts are also stellar, but somewhere between the salad and the main, even the seasoned bon vivant will throw in the towel and beg for mercy before it is offered. Most often, we are served with their (say it again......) HOMEMADE and complimetary birthday cake which is made with real butter cream and oranges or peaches. Even if you are busting at the seams, have a bite of this. It's beyond solid and tastes even better when eaten the next day on an empty stomach.

Did I mention you are served with a small cup of sorbet to cleanse the palate between the salad course and main course? Did I mention that the salad and the side dish, as well as the bread, bacon, pickles, cottage cheese, sorbet, and even mint chocolates are all included in the price of a main course? Did I mention that a meal here averages somewhere between 40-60$ per person before wine? This is what makes Gibby's a special place. While certainly not inexpensive, you get spectacular food and value for every dollar spent. I'm genuinely grateful that this place exists and in my humble opinion it continues to define the gold standard for dinner in Montreal.

Steak was excellent.  Edmund, our server was even better.  Unfortunately we were seated right by a waiter stand and got to know several waiters by their butts.

The constant clanging of dishes did not help either.  Good meal but pay attention to where you are seated!!!

We used to come here years ago when it felt like stepping into the home of a wonderful French chef, now it is just cranking out meals riding on its name amongst us tourists having lost part of its soul. We have always lived nearby, visiting occasionally since I was young. Now over priced and past its prime. Our asparagus turned into inedible broccoli (a menu change due to availability perhaps, we did not ask), our meals not memorable as the ones from years past had.

Unique looking place. Early century atmosphere. Friendly and helpful servers. I ordered the new york sirloin. It was a juicy thick cut cooked perfectly. Medium rare in the center, crispy outside,  soft inside. Definitely must try.
Spent New Years eve here, amazing staff friendly and nice. Also the food was really good with great flavor. We loved the Gibby's Cut steak and the Lobster Tail

I can't say enough great things about this restaurant. From London Ontario my Boss told me we just had to go. The service was beyond perfect. Impeccable service from everyone. Ps the pickles are to die for.

This was my first time here in Montréal, I can with family to visit Québec. I must say I will definitely will be coming back to Gibby's Restaurant. We show up to Gibby's after going White water rafting. We were not dress for this type of environment and it was 7 of us who showed up with out a reservation. From the host to the waitress welcome us with open arms. It felt so GOOD!!! I asked If We needed a reservation for us to dine they told me yes, but will work something out for us. We waited all of 5 minutes and was seated to the table of Josiane, what a wonderful woman. She made us feel at home This restaurant get 10 stars if I could.

I took my parents to dinner at Gibby's in St. Sauveur on Christmas eve where we enjoyed our respective meals and left feeling very satisfied (read: roly poly stuffed!). Because I had been warned about their sizeable portions, I opted to skip the appetizer section; both my mum and I ordered the scampi, which were melt-in-your-mouth DELICIOUS. These were accompanied by rice, asparagus and a baked potato (either plain or Monte Carlo). The meal also included a starter (Gibby's salad, gaspacho or tomatoes/onion dish). I ordered the gaspacho (chilled, tomato-based blend of fresh vegetables and herbs), which was light and simple, though a bit on the garlicky side. My only complaint was that the bowl was too big! I would have been satisfied with half of what they gave me.  My mum ordered the salad, which was a bit plain but very fresh.  

My dad started with grilled jalapeno sirloin sausage, served with mango chutney. I had a bite and found them to be nothing extraordinary. The only thing that stood out for me was how spicy they were, but the meat itself was lacking in flavour.  He then had the Rib steak (Gibby's cut), which he raved about for the rest of the night - fresh, full of flavour and about an inch thick.

We ended the night by sharing profiteroles for dessert. This dessert is meant to be for one person, but it's huge - with the sizeable meal portions, there is no way I could have eaten 3 of those! They were good, but I'm pretty sure they were frozen, which was a bit disappointing.  The wine list was OK, but not great if ordering by the glass.

Overall, a great meal, but a bit over-priced. The service was OK but not fantastic.  I recommend Gibby's if you want to treat yourself, or for special occasions. Get the scampi!

Awesome food. All served well presented. They have a valet service. 
Between courses you get sorbet, at the start of your meal you get bread, pickles and bacon. 
All the staff was extremely friendly. 
The flavour of food was unbeatable.

My husband and I went to Gibby's as an early anniversary dinner on our trip to Montreal. We had made a reservation, so we were promptly seated (in the downstairs dining room).

The service was fantastic - our waiter was very nice & funny and we didn't have to wait long for our food.

I LOVED the free pickles on the table and the bread was delicious. 

The pewter places and costumey uniforms on the servers added a nice old-world charm. The entire place just felt so cozy.

Food-wise, it's great. 

It's been a while since we went, but I'm fairly certain I can remember what we got!

To start, I went with the Gazpacho and my husband got the salad. The croutons were AMAZING.

We had planned on splitting a steak, but in the end, we splurged and each got the Filet Mignon (I got the petite). They were perfectly cooked and we both cleared our plates.

For dessert, we split the Crème Brûlée and Gibbys Chocolate Delight (a medley of smooth, dark and crunchy).

We were completely stuffed after, but it was totally worth it. I would DEFINITELY recommend Gibby's.

FOODIES: do NOT go here!!!!!! You will hate it!!

This place is the type of place my parents would enjoy.  It's dark, dingy, the server outfits are outdated, and the food is over priced.  Yet, this is a well known restaurant in Montreal so it keeps packing in the people.

Being from Texas, I know good steak, this is not good steak.  I've had better steak in Denmark.  Having traveled the world, it is rare to take a recommendation from a trusted source without first consulting Yelp but I didn't have Wifi so I went with the suggestion and now I wish I hadn't.

There is not a full service bar to eat at so if you're a single person, you will be seated at a table.  My waiter was Asian.  Nothing against him at all but from the start, you knew this was not going to be an authentic meal at all.

They bring you bread, butter, pickles and bacon pieces.  That's strange but I went with it.  All were pretty alright.

The wine selection is unimpressive to say the least.  I ordered Osso Bucco because I heard from the table next to me that the steaks were over cooked.  And I saw that the table next to me was served a well done steak.  Again, being from Texas, the cook should know better than to butcher a good cut of meat.

The Osso Bucco was a large portion and the flavor was not memorable.  As my side, I had a baked potato Monte Carlo which I was grateful for as it was the only food item I could really eat and it was not great.  On the side I was served carrots and asparagus, they were not prepared with any uniqueness at all.  They do provide you with lemon sorbet to cleanse your pallet and that tasted good, ha!  Oh, they do give you tiny chocolate square when you pay that are edible.

I don't know why people dine here, I can get better food at Texas Roadhouse.  I guess it's nostalgia?? I looked around the dining room and there were both young & old people so I'm guessing it's their reputation or name that keeps them in business.  

I wouldn't dine there again.

Gibbys is a sentimental favourite for me.  As a student, we celebrated graduations and birthdays here, and my husband brought me here the night he proposed.  We hadn't been back in about 10 years, so we were overdue for a return visit.  We brought my parents and my 14 year old daughter.  The decor is exactly the same, rustic and charming but slightly frayed around the edges.  Service is a delight, attentive and professional.  Steaks were very good.
