They are on the pricey side, but the thing I like about Gibbys is that they include starter and sides with their steaks.  I have a real gripe with steak houses that charge you $60 for a steak and can't throw a potato and a few greens on your plate for free.  

My mom had the salmon and said it was excellent.  It was a huge serving and enough for lunch the next day.  

Mom and dad both enjoyed Irish coffees after the meal, expensive at $16 each, but prepared table side with a flourish, so worth a splurge.  The one disappointment of the night was my daughter's profiteroles, the pastry was stale and they went largely uneaten.  

It's comforting to have a few places that never change... stay classy, Gibbys.

Steak was quite good, but this location felt quite old, like it was not updated. Some people may feel it gives the place a unique charm, but I feel thay there are plenty of other options with nicer decor with steak that is as good if not better.

I'm not sure why they serve pickles with the bread, but they are fantastic!  I had a hard time not eating all of them.  I ordered a ribeye that was rubbed with garlic and it was cooked perfectly!  I have been to a lot of high end steakhouses and I can honestly say this steak is near the top of the list.  I wasn't a huge fan of the atmosphere though.  For the price, it was pretty loud and crowded and tables were basically crammed into a giant room with very little in the way of ambiance.  The service, on the other hand, was top notch.  The waiter was excellent at being very attentive without seeming like he was hovering over us.  Our water and wine were constantly refilled and the food came out at an excellent pace.

If you're looking for a really proper, old school, steak house, this is it. The steak is fantastic, and they have Wellington on the menu which is such a delight. This is not a fine dining steak house, nor is it a secluded date spot, but it is a great place to have a very good meal. In fact, the steak here was better than most of the steaks I've had at "upscale" steak houses.

To be honest, they got me at the bacon and homemade dill pickles (which you get as soon as you sit down). I even bought a bottle of the dills to bring home with me. True story.

Brilliant! My work colleague had the Beef Wellington and I, Steak Diane. Both were cooked to perfection. Served with twice baked or was it thrice baked potatoes, asparagus and roasted red peppers. Beautiful.

What not to like about this restaurant?  The setting is beautiful and unique.  The food?  Outstanding!  And I have been to some of best steak places in NY, peter lugar included.  This place topped all.  I loved the sirloin en croute with delicious mustard sauce!  It pained me and my hubby to have to leave some behind as we had no place to keep leftovers!  Now if I can replicate this at home??

After all the Yelp hype and personal recommendations, I was so disappointed to discover that Gibby's did not live up to either.  I went a couple of months ago for a work trip with 4 other people from my company, 3 of which were of the same opinion as myself about the food.  

We started with the salad with Gibby's signature dressing.  I will pat Gibby's on the back for their AMAZING homemade salad dressing... I tried to buy a bottle or two, but they were repackaging it and didn't have any on hand at the time.  I'm sorry to say the salad dressing was the highlight of the evening and things went south from there.

My coworker and I ordered the beef wellington next.  I have never tasted a more bland and utterly inedible piece of meat in my life... my coworker felt the same.  I wouldn't have taken a second bite if my boss wasn't paying $50 for the thing.  It tasted like it was barely sprinkled with salt - no other marination whatsoever.  The accompanying mushroom gravy, A1, and Worcestershire didn't help either.  I couldn't imagine how much worse it could taste reheated, so I most certainly did not take the rest to go.

Another coworker who ordered the rib eye steak was also not impressed, even after dousing it in the sauces mentioned above.  Another coworker order the fish course, which she was not fond of either.  Our team is from Texas and we've had some truly great steaks there for half the cost of Gibby's.  

The service, however, was excellent.  I couldn't bring myself to mention to our kind and attentive waiter how disappointed I was about my main course. 

If you've absolutely got to experience Gibby's, have the salad, a side dish and dessert and stay for the cozy atmosphere and great service.

Every time I visit the city I make it a point to eat dinner at Gibby's. Great steaks. Great drinks. The service is good considering how busy they get o the weekends. The prices are tourist focused so do not go there looking for a discount meal but you will not walk away hungry. No way. 

Parking in this area of the city  is very tight so there early and be prepared to search for a parking spot.

AMAZING FOOD plus the service and ambiance are incredible, too. Bar upstairs to drink while you wait for seating. Definitely try the oysters and lobster - to die for! The sorbet in between dishes really helps clear the palate and the pickles with bacon bread is a unique and yummy starter.

Lovely place (where they serve everything on metal plates, zomg)!

Inviting and comforting interior, great service and amazing food.

The bread they give you is amazeballs, the pickles are great too...but the bread is where it's at (ate way too much of it). 

I started with a French onion soup, it was good, I liked the sweetness it had.
For my main I had the steak Diane, $50 isn't cheap but it came with two (!) huge filet mignons.
So technically you could eat that one plate with two people, it was really that much.

On top of that it was my birthday dinner and the waitress served me a birthday cake (big enough for all four of us) and took a picture of me & company, which she later gave me in a Gibby's envelope.

It was a great evening.

So much food!

I'm coming back here for sure, but skipping the appetizers...and probably try to resist the bread (as if).
Awesome place in an Old part of Montreal. The pickles, gazpacho soup, lobsters, sorbet and homemade mint chocolate are sooo delicious that I will defenetly be back for more.

Went here after many friends telling me this place was excellent and I have to say I was quite disappointed. My steak arrived over cooked when I asked for medium rare. By the time I got the plate back I wasnt even hungry anymore since I had stuffed myself with the Monte Carlo potato and the bread at the beginning. Moishe's is definitely better. Not sure I would give them a second chance.

Gibby's is one of my favorite restaurants in Montreal, so my husband and I made reservations to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary on a Friday night in February.

From start to finish, I was disappointed with the whole evening.  We were given a table in the very back of the main floor, wedged between a rowdy table of 6 and only inches away from another couple.  It seemed like we were in the party section as all the other groups around us were loud and boisterous.  We asked to move to somewhere more quiet, but were told that "It's a busy night" and no other tables were available.  So much for an intimate, romantic evening :-(

The waiter, although polite to a fault, seemed almost passive-aggressive and a little condescending... And the usually quick service was so slow that we noticed the table beside us turned TWICE in the time it took us to receive our main course. 

Our appetizers were delicious - when we finally received them. I had the  smoked salmon and my husband had the mussels.     Both were perfection.  The main course arrived quite some time later and while my husband enjoyed his grilled salmon, my filet mignon was cold and under-cooked to the point that I could barely choke it down.  It was so bloody, it made a soupy mess on my plate - I had asked for medium-well.

Dessert was somewhat redeeming.  My husband opted for the sorbet trio, which was the perfect light ending to his meal.  I chose the more decadent chocolate delight, which was scrumptious - though had I actually eaten my main course I probably would not have been able to finish it.

Overall, the evening was a disappointment because I know how good Gibby's CAN be. It just sucks that they were having an off night on our anniversary :-(

FOODIES: DO go here!!!!!! You will love it!!

This place is the type of place my parents would enjoy.  It's dark, rustic, the server outfits are traditional, and the food is nicely priced, unless you are from Texas. So naturally, this is a well known restaurant in Montreal so it keeps packing in the people.

Being from the less racist part of Texas, I know good steak, this is good steak.  I've not had better steak in Denmark.  Having traveled the world, and trekked with gorillas, it is rare to take a recommendation from a trusted source without first consulting Yelp but I didn't have Wifi so I went with the suggestion and now I'm thrilled I did. Just kidding, I don't give Yelp that much credit because come on it's Yelp.

There is not a full service bar to eat at so if you're a single person, you will be seated at a table.  But fortunately I'm not single, so we got a nice table. My waiter was Asian. Nothing against him at all but from the start, I knew his race would not affect the authenticity of the meal at all.

They bring you bread, butter, pickles and bacon pieces.  That's strange but I went with it.  All were pretty alright.

We got the 20oz rib steak Gibby's cup with herbs and spices medium rare. It was near perfect. Not he best steak ever but it hit the spot. We were able to share and had leftovers. Also got lobster tail, mushroom tart, and they came with generous portions of sides. All were delicious.

We also got some wine and cognac. Generous pours. Need I say more? Oh, excellent service.

I now know why people dine here, I can't get better food at Texas Roadhouse. That's not surprising. I looked around the dining room and there were both young & old people so I'm guessing it's their reputation or name that keeps them in business.  

I would dine there again and highly recommend.

Good restaurant overall.  The creamed spinach was nice and the Monte Carlo potatoes with the entree was very good.  The steak was well marbled and had a good consistency was ok.  For a non-aged steak it was flavored well and cooked to the right temperature.  The palate cleanser before the main meal was a nice touch.

Went to Gibbys to celebrate my boyfriend's 31st birthday. What a curious establishment. It feels like the type of fancy restaurant geared to families in the 1970s, but not one thing has changed since then. You get a bowl of pickles and a stick of butter with your bread to start. And they go around individually serving croutons for your salad like they're still a novelty. Food is pretty simple but if you want to dazzle it up, they'll give you a little bowl of capers to spoon on top of anything you order. In the end we really enjoyed ourselves because we got to peak into a world we never see. A world where culinary progress stopped dead in it's tracks sometime before I was born. But the food was pretty good just the same.

While in Montreal, I visited this place once again. The food and service is still consistently 5 Star. I even had the same 2 lb Lobster!!!! You just can't go wrong with this place. Where everyone jacks your bill up with everything a la carte, Gibbys gives you a complete meal for one price. You even get a small taste of sherbet in between courses to cleanse the palate. This is truly a must for a great business or special occasion dinner. Enjoy!!!!

Classic Old School Steakhouse done right... Ordered my bone-in (Gibby's Cut) Rib Eye medium rare alla Cajun style... Perfectly seared and absolutely delicious... Go and eat here!  That is all I have to say!

PROS:
-Great steaks, cooked to perfection. 
P.S. The steaks are MASSIVE (15 OUNCES!!!) :-O

-Complimentary pickles, bread, and a light lemon sorbet between your salad and entree. 

-Great place to go for steak and special occasions.

-Friendly service and not pretentious as might be expected. 

CONS:
-Not a place I would go to more than once a year.

High quality steaks and the like. Was here with a group of 10 colleagues for a business holiday dinner. Enjoyable, big meal complete with decent red wines and a very chocolately dessert. Cost is on the higher end but not unreasonable for the vieux port.

When you eat here make sure to take it easy on the bread or you probably won't have room for the rest of the meal. It comes as a warm loaf, and everyone I have eaten here with needed massive self discipline to avoid scarfing down the entire loaf.  It's a cozy place with subdued lighting. I've had some nights here with less than perfect service of my seat was out of the way, but in general it's not been a major issue. The food is good, I always order the steak when I'm here.

We were visiting from the US and stopped in here for some steaks. Wow. Excellent food, awesome setting. The atmosphere is really laid back, it's busy but quiet. The steaks were incredible. The desserts were great.  The coffee was to out of this world. If ever in Montreal again, would love to come back! 

Does anyone know what brand coffee they use here?  Man, would love to get my hands on some of it.

We came on a good friends recommendation. We took an 8.45pm booking.

On arrival the restaurant was fully occupied so we dined downstairs - which was also full. The welcome and service was friendly attentive and informative. We were given ample time to select our options. I do like the initially serving of the pickles...what a healthy and different starter.

An important aspect to selecting a main course is that it comes with a three starter option of which we choose a salad and a soup. This is built into the pricing of the main dish. The menu is dominated by fish and steak.

We really enjoyed the gazpacho soup - the salad was more basic. On the night my partner was looking for a white meat option and choose the only one, Chicken Kiev. On reflection not a wise decision given the focus of the menu.....this dish was ordinary. Conversely the Fillet Mignon was a splendid choice. Presented to perfection as was the taste.....a very substantial piece and was adequate for us both to share. 

We shared a crepe, the 'Jubilee'- it was all ice cream and limited crepe.

A good wine list and we enjoyed an Amarone, a reserve - it was drinking well. We did have to request that it be decanted.

This is not a fine establishment - it is all about the red meat (and the fish).....come with an appetite and you will not be disappointed.

Been here twice now. Once for a bachelor party and once with my wife and another couple. The food here awesome. Got the Gibby's cut steak. Massive steak. Cooked perfectly. The Monte Carlo potato was awesome. The service here really makes this place stand out in my mind though.

The first time I was there our server overheard us talking about it being a bachelor party and without warning brought us a congrats cake on the house. Amazing. Second time our server was also very attentive. It's like he knew what we wanted before we did.

Great place overall. Good price for what you get. Some of the best service I've ever had.

I would move to Montreal just to go to Gibby's on a regular basis.  After reading the reviews here (thank you Nicholas M), we decided to keep Gibby's on the list of possibilities.  We were up in Montreal for the weekend (basically, all day Saturday, and Sunday morning) with a hockey fan club (Go Devils!!).  After walking around Old Montreal for the day, my hubby and I went back to our hotel to freshen up and head back out for dinner.  We were staying in the trade center and there weren't too many options for dinner (or nightlife), so we wandered down Rue McGill for about 15 minutes, didn't see anything that interested us, so we went back to the hotel to get directions to Gibby's.  Thankfully, we did!!!   We walked about another 15 minutes, turned the corner, and found it - very unassuming - stone/brick front, people waiting in the alcove for the valet parking attendants to bring their cars around...we weren't really sure where the door was, but had 4 people following behind us and we wanted to get in before they did in order to get a table first!  (LOL)...  We found our way in to the packed lobby, the hostess took our name and noted that we were a party of 2, and told us it would be about 45 minutes, but we could go upstairs to the lounge and order a drink while we waited.  We said sure and were lead upstairs to a huge lounge, with only about 8 other people waiting.  We sat at a little table by the fireplace, and ordered 2 glasses of wine from the waitress.  She brought our wine and the hostess came up to tell us that our table was ready!!  The dining room was packed, but not too loud.  The decor was stone and exposed beams and after reading our menus, we found out the history of the 400 year old building (it was part of the stable and the hospital run by the Grey Nuns)....    We checked out the menu and I decided on the Grilled Swordfish special, while my husband got the full-sized filet mignon.  We noticed that all entrees came with a salad, a choice of baked potato, Monte Carlo potato (twice baked potato, blended with sour cream, bacon, and cheese - THANK YOU, AGAIN, NICHOLAS M!!), rice pilaf, and asparagus spears, so we opted out of getting an appetizer since it seemed that the entrees themselves would be more then enough.  After a loaf of tasty, fresh bread was delivered, our salads arrived, and although they were salads (with fresh ground pepper added at the table, and fresh, crunchy, but chewy, croutons, also added at the table) these were the best salads I've ever had (there was a little kick to the balsamic vinaigrette dressing, and some serious garlic...YUM)  After we finished those, a scoop of palate-cleansing lemon sorbet was brought to the table.    Then came our entrees....which were filled with one of the best meals that money can buy (or at least, the best grilled swordfish, filet mignon, potatoes, and asparagus that we've ever had) - My swordfish was perfectly grilled, with the grill marks and all - it tasted like a steak!!  It was PERFECT!  My husband ordered his filet with a  medium temperature - it was more toward medium rare (which is my choice), but definitely NOT disappointing to him nor me!  And the Monte Carlo potato...to die for!  Baked, and re-stuffed with the potato, blended with just the right amount of cheese, sour cream, and bacon, not so you could taste any one part separately, but so all parts 'blended' together into one palate-pleasing medley.  And the asparagus was good, too...  Before our meals came, we noticed some desserts going out to the tables around us and I said 'no matter how full we are, WE ARE GETTING A DESSERT'!!!  Unfortunately, we just had to finish our dinners because we couldn't stop eating, and couldn't let such a fabulous meal end - we had not one inch of room for dessert.  I asked our waitress what time they opened on Sunday, because we were going to come back JUST for dessert, but they open at 5 PM on Sundays, and we would be on our way back to NJ by then.  Next time, I WILL make room for the pastry with the apples and caramel and ice cream, or the chocolate thing that we saw passing our table....  Apparently, Gibby's is the place to go, and  you should have reservations (we found this out on Sunday, after speaking with a 'native' Montreal-an) - but we lucked out and didn't have to wait long for our dining enjoyment.  The prices were a little high (dinner for 2, with all the accompaniments and 2 glasses of wine each, came to about $100/couple) - However, it was definitely worth it for the quality meal and friendly service that we received.  PS - don't go if you are in a rush - they give you time to enjoy your experience - we were there about 2 hours...which was fine with us - We will be back, Gibby's - see you soon!!!  XO

The food we had was amazing! They gave my wife a little birthday cake and took a photo of us and put it in a framed card to take home. Very cool and thoughtful. The service was a pleasure as well. The only downside is that we were leaving the next day so we could take home the abundant leftovers!
Incredible food and great service. Loved our steaks and lobster. Cocked perfectly and served correctly. 2 thumbs up.
Best meal that I've had in years. Definitely stop by if you want an affordable dinner experience in Montreal.

Was up in Montreal for a weekend with friends, and made a reservation @ Gibbys based on a few recommendations. The setting is different than the vast majority in NYC, and surrounding areas. It has an old feel with the entrance being hidden in a stone walkway to a courtyard. As you enter you notice the exposed framework made from big, heavy timber, warmly lit, and a feeling you just went back a hundred and fifty years. The waiters wear, I'm assuming, a sort of traditional uniform and were the most polite and bubbly servers we had in Montreal. 

The recommendations were spot on, the spicy sirloin sausage was great and the Oysters Rockefeller were insanely good. I pride myself on my impeccable manners, thanks mom, but I definitely grabbed a second before confirming everyone got at least one. 

I ordered the center cut fillet, and the waitress coerced me into the Monte Carlo potato; I buckled, but assured my self I would only eat 1/2 of it. Turns out I took it right to face, killed it, it was amazing... the fillet was cooked perfectly, and with a table of 8, all ordering a various steaks, each of ours were cooked perfectly. 

We were all discussing how amazing the dinner was, thinking the ride was over. We then ordered some Irish coffees... they rolled over what appeared to be a dessert cart with a big flame in the middle... they caramelized sugar on the rim, lit the whiskey in the glass on fire (then added a little more). Added the coffee, fresh whip cream, and then lit Irish Mist on fire, and poured the flaming liquor into the best Irish Coffee I've ever had.  Gibby's is the Truth.

Interesting restaurant, only a 3 star because they have a "full bar" but not able to make any drinks.
Black Manhattan- no
Boulevardier- no
Old fashioned? Yes but not able to do it correctly. No orange peel or anything.

Crappy beer selection, and basically come for the food, don't expect a good cocktail before dinner.
Fail-proof steakhouse, never disappoints. Service is impeccable and I enjoy the wine selection.

Hands down, my favorite restaurant on the planet. I live in New York City and this restaurant is a good 5-6 hour drive, some fridays after work i legitametly wrestle with the idea of going up for the night just to have Gibbys. The service is top notch, atmosphere is extremely rustic, almost a medieval feel but i love that. Stone walls with raw wood trim everywhere, roaring fireplace, the works.  Everytime i go i get the escargot to start which is the best ive had and the steak en croute. Its an expensive dish, no doubt, but extremely tasty and worth the hefty asking price of $42.00. Its basically breaded steak cooked to perfection, served with a warm mustard peppercorn sauce on the side. Bliss. If i were to have one gripe about this place and it is only one, that is their beer selection. Nothing from canada on tap. As a matter of fact there is nothing on tap at all. The wine selection is endless but i would love to be able to have a hearty pint of Rickards Red with my steak.
We came here on a friends recommendation.  The food was good, but not really a wow.  The best part was the twice baked potato. The place itself was quaint and cozy & it was nice to see old Montreal.

This elegant, long-standing restaurant is housed in a 200 year old stable by the waterfront in Old Montreal. I've only been here on rare occasion, for special celebrations, and the last time was over 30 years ago. I brought my daughters here tonight so they can experience one of the city's finer establishments. And I was so glad at it was just as I remembered it to be: gentile and refined with a sense of tradition and history the moment you walk in.

First, how wonderful that they offer free valet parking. I made it known that we were just coming in for desserts and coffee, and they were still happy to park my car for me (note: as many may know, parking is a royal pain in the patootie on a busy Friday night at 8pm in the summer! And nearby lots cost $15 to park in them). 

We were told they could seat is in 30 minutes, so we strolled the old port and Place Jacques Cartier Square, marveling in the business and vibrancy of this great city. Upon returning to the restaurant, we were immediately seated. Tables clothed in white linens, leather-bound dessert menus at our seats. The waitresses were all dressed in period uniforms from the last century. 

Oh, and the food was divine! My youngest had the epitome of a chocoholic's fantasy: the Chocolate Delight,which was a decadent chocolate mousse-like cake with a crunchy chocolate topping, plated on a gorgeous swirled sauce. She said it was the best dessert she ever had. Meanwhile, my other kid and I shared the Crepe Cerise Jubilee: a thin, delicate crepe with vanilla ice cream with lots of cherries (and some blueberries). This was, hands down, the best dessert I've ever had. Ever. I was in heaven. 

My cappuccino was too strong for me, but my daughters enjoyed their French teas. And how lovely, to get some dark mint chocolate medallions on our table as a complimentary treat. Very lovely gesture.

Wow.... What the Keg should be.

It feels so warm and cozy inside. Only way that it would feel better, would be at a ski lodge on Christmas, after a day of cross country skiing.
 The food was phenomenal and great whisky /drinks menu. Steak.... WOW!! Great portions as well.
  I most definitely would love to come back if and when I go back to Montreal.

It's a good restaurant in a really cool location (old horse stables), but for the cost better can be had.

For a steak house in this price range, I expect better. Check out Queue de Cheval...it's a bit more expensive but the food is infinitely better.

First time dining at old port and it was an amazing experience. Service was really great and friendly. Would definitively go again probably once a year since i dont have a job hahaha but yes the food was delicious. Salad comes as an apettitzer along with sorbets to cleanse your taste. I ordered the beef wellington, the beef was really tender and the sauce was compatible with it.

Excellent service and food! We had Valerie who served our table. She is the best! Always on the beat and understand quickly our request. I ordered Guibby's cut and my mom ordered New York cut. Both steaks are amazing! And the sorbet is just devine. Even the free bread and pickles are delicious! This meal definitely worth the price and we will come back.

Me and my Wife celebrated our anniversary at Gibbys and had an absolute great time! Portions were amazing and the food quality was top notch. Highly recommend This restaurant to anyone wanting to have a great candlelight dinner. 

They also sent us away with a full cake after learning it was our anniversary!!

Went to Gibby's for our one year anniversary. We came from NJ and my wife and I are self proclaimed steakhouse connoisseurs. We where thoroughly impressed by a combination of the decor, service and quality of food. We started with the signature Gibby's salad which was great. My wife ordered the surf and turf and got the beef Wellington.  Both meals where executed to perfection and to put the icing on the cake the meals where not a la carte which is a great thing. I definitely recommend this place whenever in Montreal.

Ok looks like I will have to come back again ...I was not impressed with Gibby's rib Steak perhaps, I came on the wrong day; but from a taste (let in savor in your mouth each bite for  30 seconds) perspective it did not make my top 10 steakhouse list ... The baked bread and pickles were excellent as were our side dishes. Atmosphere cosy, sweet decor, great place for a date.  Our server was a little loud excitable but friendly as compared to what you might find in other venues in other cities. I will come back I have a feeling I won't be disappointed the next time around.
Amazing! I went last night with my fiancé, the food is delicious and the service great! I strongly recommend to leave room for the crepe jubilee, it is so so good!

According to a friend who is a local, Gibby's is an "institution." It is very old and very rustic, a classic steakhouse. 

I'm not a big steak eater so I ordered the Chicken Kiev. This was the first time I ever ordered this dish and the waitress had told me to be careful but I didn't quite catch on. My first cut through the chicken caused hot liquid butter to squirt out all over my brand new top. I was a mess! Our waitress, Nadia, was very nice and brought me some club soda. You live and you learn!

The chicken was delicious, even after all that. My husband and our friend both enjoyed their steaks. We all shared the creme brûlée for dessert which was good, but nothing to write home about. 

I liked this place but since steakhouses are not really my thing, I will give it four stars.

Just perfect, from polite valet parking to a professional waiter namer Rainor. The food is perfect. The meat is tender and remarkably tasty, the Monte Carlo potato is wonderful. The lobster is also remarkable. All in a pleasant setting with truly professional unhurried service. Wow....I grew up in this town and have been away for years. I come here when I visit family and what amazes me is how consistently good this restaurant is. It is world class...Bravo!!!

We had a company dinner at Gibby's this week for a work dinner.  Service was great, food was pretty good but the steak was overlooked.  Definitely get the Monte Carlo potato. YUM!  Great location, but I recommend sitting upstairs...the downstairs had a really low ceiling that made it a bit crowded.  Overall great spot to try!

My wife and I flew up from North Carolina and had dinner on Friday night at Gibby's.  We had browsed the menu online.  She had the Beef Wellington and I had Sirloin en Croûte.  I have to say it was the best piece of beef I have had anywhere.  The portions were such that we could not eat all of it.  So we took it back to the motel, borrowed a knife and sliced it for lunch on Saturday.  Anyone visiting Montreal should go to Gibby's, but be sure to make a reservation because it is popular and without a reservation it could be a long wait.
Beef Wellington with monte cristo potato was delicious. Server could not have been more patient with our bachelor party of 10.

Excellent restaurant! The service was exceptional and the food was even better. If you're looking for fine dining without the exorbitant pricing, Gibbys is the place for you. While you will pay more on average compared to other restaurants, it's well worth the price of admission and you'll leave full & satisfied. The steaks savory & succulent, cooked to perfection and tailored to your preferences.

I live in the States about 11/2 hr drive to Gibby's.  We have been going to Gibby's for over 10 years.  When we have a visitors or something to celebrate or just haveing a Gibby's craving we will make the short trip,  It is well worth the drive.  I have eaten at all the top steak house's in the US.. Morton's, Ruth Chris, Flemings, Capital Grill and more.  Gibby's is in a class all of its own.  The combination of old world ambiance, great service, consistently great food and out of this world desserts makes it a must go to if you are in the Montreal area.  After your very satisfying meal you can roam about Old Montreal on foot or take a ride in one of the many horse drawn carriages that you will find in the area.

2 stars is accurate for the experience we had especially since our stay in Montreal has been a culinary extravaganza. 
The good: Napa wine and crown Manhattans
The average: the service; wasn't up to par with every other restaurant we visited in terms of sincerity and helpfulness. 
The bad: my "Gibby cut" was overdone and my wife's fillet was underdone-they were sent back. We were 1 of 3 tables (that we witnessed next to us) that had "temperature" issues. The manager did not charge us for the Rockefeller oysters which, for sure, were made with an "Italian herb mix" because they smelled and tasted like pizza.  Also, I pointed out to the waiter that 1) there are lots of spider webs around the picture frames that have been there a while because of the dust build up, and 2) the centipedes crawling in and out of the old stone wall were...not appealing (another table next to us, they did not have temperature issues, said on previous visits that they have had centipedes jump from the wall onto their table). 
Unfortunately, we must have hit a bad night because the Yelp reviews are spectacular, plus, two different friends from home strongly recommended this place, but, we can't deny what we had or experienced...we do not recommend this restaurant nor will we return. I hate to write poor reviews, but, with the high quality of food and service we've experienced in the last week we cannot justify the risk of another sub par meal when the city is filled with fabulous cuisine.
Food was average. Server was fabulous. Order the clam chowder, have a pickle, a glass of wine and desert. Petit Filet was over cooked.

Fantastic steak house in Old Port Montréal. The food was fantastic, and reasonably priced given the caliber of the restaurant. Our server was good, the food was even better. The bread and pickles were delicious, as was the salad. The Monte Carlo was FANTASTIC, definitely order that as your side! There was lemon sorbet in between courses, which was a nice touch. I ordered the petit filet mignon and a lobster tail- both great. I ordered the steak medium and it was perfect. We ordered the crème brulée for desert; also delicious and plenty big enough for two. I strongly recommend Gibby's. Great food, great environment. Classic steakhouse with that desirable Montréal feel.

Twas the night of a bachelor party, and Montreal was stirring. We'd eaten many hours ago, and our stomachs were purring. A top three steak house and dishes seemingly hard to beat; I think I would've enjoyed my meal had they just turned down the heat!

Poetry seems fun as I write this review from the air on my way back from a weekend full of debauchery in Montreal. Gibby's. Oh Gibby's. I'm torn on the rating here. We were a large group in a very crowded basement dining room (had a country club grill room feel to it).

Eight of us seated at a round table that would've been optimal for six. The trouble came when the servers had to get to the far side against the wall, a feat only accomplished by squeezing between chairs and reaching over others. Staff didn't come around much in the beginning though, and we probably sat around for 20 minutes after the drinks came before ordering any food. Meh.

Things picked up once the meal was served, so on to the important part; the meal.

Here were the orders around the room:
- Petit filet mignon
- 2 lbs lobster
- NY strip
- sirloin en croute
- tuna steak
- salmon
- halibut

They provided a lovely bib for our lobster eater; he looked like he was going to the dentist. Funny stuff. We all enjoyed our food. My tuna was expertly prepared. So you're wondering, why am I torn?

Although the featured items were great (minus one issue with an overcooked sirloin en croute), the dish also included a choice of rice pilaf/baked potato/baked potato Monte Carlo and asparagus. A lot of steakhouses only serve sides a la carte, so this was a perceived plus...

Most of us ordered the rice pilaf, which the sever described as wild rice. It tasted great, but was nothing more than plain rice with some specs in it. We each received three spears of asparagus. 

Herein lies my issue. A top steakhouse can have real wild rice and can afford to be a little more generous with the vegetable, no?

In the end, I felt that at least my dish could've been something I made myself. That's not what I expect at a top establishment. So what I felt I got was a really good tuna steak with some rice and a little asparagus that I could've made and spent less money on, all the while enjoying a drastically more comfortable dining environment. The restroom area was at least 15 degrees cooler.

The restaurant did comp our coffees because of the overcooked steak, and they also made a complimentary special cake for our special bachelor, which was very, very nice. 

Unfortunately this place left me feeling underwhelmed, especially in comparison to some of the other steakhouse experiences I've had.

All things considered, I respectfully submit three stars for Gibby's. A fine place, but I'd likely look for a new place given the chance to return to Montreal.

What an unforgettable experience!!! 
Their service and food were outstanding. We came here to celebrate my husbands bday while on our first visit to Montreal.  And I'm so happy that we chose Gibbys. 

I would like to start this review with a huge Thank You to our server Tammy! She was so great, attentive and had such wonderful energy. 

We ordered fillet and lobster with a side of baked potato.  The portions are massive. Their salad was delicious. Bread was sooo good. 

Little things like after the salad, gelato was served to clean your pallet. Warm water with fresh lemons was served to rinse our hands after lobster.....  blew my mind. Nothing really surprises me much and very rare a particular restaurant exceeds my expectations. This one did. 

When Tammy found out it was my Husbands birthday, they brought out a small cake with candles!!!!! Not a piece of cake but a small entire cake.  Insane! Their dark chocolates made on premises ... Delicious!!!! Apparently all is made on premises. 

She then came out with a camera to take a pic of us. I'm thinking they'll post this on the restaurants site or something. Nope. She came out with 2 printed pictures each packed in Gibbys paper card. 

Basically, their attention to detail is nothing like I have ever seen. And we as a group dined in some amazing restaurants in NY and DC. 

Again, Thrilled with our experience and will recommend this place to anyone who makes it out to Montreal.

This now fine dining establishment used to be a horse stable in the 1700's. Much of the stone building was still a part of the modern day restaurant today. We went on Memorial Day Monday which is not a holiday in Canada, so it made reservations a piece of cake. 

The pickles and bread that come beforehand were delicious. The odd thing though was that the bread came with a dish of bacon bits. Now, I know that bacon makes everything better, but no one was quite sure on what to do with it. However, who are we to question it. We ate our bacon and it was good!!!

Ordered french onion soup and shrimp bisque for apps. The FO soup was really good. Very traditional French presentation and flavor. The shrimp bisque was ok, but was my least favorite item during the meal. After the app course, they gave us lemon sorbet as a pallet cleanser. This was a nice touch!!!

The entrees consisted of petit filet and regular filet. They were $43 and $49 respectively. They came with asparagus and a baked potato/twice baked potato/or rice pilaf.  The steaks were both huge. Both steaks came out perfectly cooked coated with a pepper/onion/garlic seasoning that was great. We added on a side of mushrooms that were tasty as well. We also ordered 2 bottles of Cote de Rhone wine. It was delicious. On a side note, they were offering a 2 lbs lobster for only $47 dollars. Not a bad deal at all. If I did not live in Boston and was not at a steak house, I would have gone with the lobster for sure.

For dessert we shared a triple chocolate dessert. It was light and delicious and the perfect ending to the meal. They also gave us chocolate thin mints that were actually chocolate, not the standard mints that one usually sees. 

The server was friendly and nice, but disappeared toward the end of the meal. When she came back to the table smelling like tobacco smoke, we knew where she went. While we may have been her last table, this knocked a star off the review. With that being said, if you are ever in Montreal, this place is a must.

Excellent service, food and decor. The old stable barn is quite the unique setting and provides great ambiance. The food was amazing: we had the sausage, shrimp and mushroom tart for appetizers and each one was superb. I had the petite filet and it was cooked perfectly. Highly recommend this place.

I came to gobby's on the recommendation of the hotel front desk trainee. It's interior is nothing fancy. The food and service, however were tops. The best onion soup one can expect to find in Montreal, or anywhere else in the world.  The bone-in ribeye was excellent and service very good.  Gibby's is definitely a place to put on the must-come-back-to list.

I can't give this place less than 5 stars. It's become a family and friend tradition when we're in Montreal. AND everyone loves the big giant juicy steak after spending a day in the sun at the F1 tracks.

The staff always treats us well here. We called about a week beforehand and they told us they were full until 10pm. We pleaded with them informing them we only come once a year and it's our favorite restaurant, so he was able to accommodate us at 7:30pm with this long table in the back for 14 people. Knowing we were hungry, the waiter brought over the pickles and bread and butter. We quickly scarfed it down and each ordered our own entree.

The table got the Gibby's steak, artic char, beef wellington and a few other steaks. My Gibby's steak, which I get in rare, was pretty good. I wouldn't say it's the best steak of my life, but it was passing. The steak was cooked to how I like it. Everyone seemed to be pretty satisfied with their meals.

I wouldn't take a date here though. It's dark and gives you that old mansion feel.

Enjoyed a lovely evening with great friends over a tasty grilled & sizzled to perfection rib eye steak with unlimited bread and pickles, a delicious salad, a Monte Carlo Potato at Gibbys Restaurant (My Top 5 must eat resto) in #Montreal.
Excellent steak! The twice baked potato is also really good. Also had the clam chowder but be aware, it's quite heavy.

My friends and I came to Montreal to celebrate a friends birthday. We decided to try out Gibbys after reading all the reviews. We are so glad we went. To begin, this place is so nice and comforting inside. You feel like you're in a cottage with how the holiday decor looked. All the waiters and waitresses were beyond nice and helpful. We started off with a bunch of appetizers: the jalapeño sausage, mushroom tart, and French onion soup. Loved all of it! I'm not the biggest fan of mushrooms, but the tart was very tasty. The French onion soup was delicious with all that gooey cheese. The sausage came with mango chutney which paired well with it due to the sweet and spicy. At the table itself, they serve pickles, bread/butter, and a bowl of bacon bites. We were all in love. We each ordered our individual entrees (which the lady told us when ordering appetizers it's a lot of food, but we didn't care). My petite filet was good, however a little undercooked from what i had asked. Right away the waitress took it back and within minutes brought me a new plate with new sides. I was beyond shocked because usually i would just get the steak back. The Monte Carlo baked potato was really good with sour cream, bacon and chives. The asparagus was okay, a little too thick. 

For dessert we ordered a cake for my friend, which you can tell was homemade. The cake itself was very light and fluffy and the cream was a fresh buttercream. Others at table ordered the tableside Irish coffee which was a wonderful show to end our evening and it tasted so good. Once we were done (we were one of the last groups in the restaurant, we asked if they can take a picture which they did and even helped us "stage" the picture by picking a nice backdrop and moving the tables/chairs. 

Hands down one of the best steakhouses I've been.

On one of my walks through Old Montreal, I happened to stumble upon this "horse-stable-turned-restaurant" built in parts, between 1694 to 1850 and decided right away that this is where I wanted to have my anniversary dinner with my husband that same week. Very, very happy with our choice, the location is beautiful, the service was impeccable and the food is fantastic! All the staff were also very friendly and accommodating in making sure we got exactly the type of wine we wanted. Was a lovely anniversary dinner.
Beautiful location, very friendly staff.  Had the beef Wellington.  Amazing.  Large portion but so very good you just had to eat it all.  Very knowledgeable staff.

Great traditional steakhouse with plenty to choose from on the menu. Rib eye is delicious and cooked to perfection. 

Great atmosphere and excellent service. Seafood options are great and one of our guest said the halibut was great. 

You won't go Hungary here with the big portions. 

Will be back when we come to town.

I found it expensive for what it was.  Very old school.  I started with the escargots - which were tasty, if a little salty and rubbery.  I was then brought a mixed green salad, which consisted mainly of iceberg lettuce (which was a bit rusty). I ordered a filet mignon for my main, although it looked as though it was cooked perfectly (medium rare) strangely it was rather dry and at least one other dining companion had the same complaint. Could it be that the meat had been frozen and defrosted rendering it bloodless? The accompanying rice was so dry and tasteless it would be better served coming out of a Gatling gun, absolutely dreadful. The sorbet in between courses was ok if that's your thing and the pickles were rockin'. I ordered a Brazilian coffee to finish as I heard that they put on quite a show. They roll up in some rickety old cart and heat the glass etc etc, not very impressive honestly.  The service was ok. Our server was kind of grumpy at first and then got friendly as the night went on. One of the servers looked really anorexic. The horrible uniform they make them wear was hanging off her skeletal frame. Not who'd you'd expect to be serving your food - you have to wonder what she's doing on her break? I'm sure I'm forgetting something but that speaks for itself.  Overall I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. It's dated and a tourist trap.
This place was awesome! Everything we ate was fantastic. Steak was great. Still think about the escargot. Highly recommend!

Decor : Very rustic and home-like decor. 

Food : a little pricey, but very good and worth it. Everything is well seasoned and well cooked. 

Service : The staff is very dedicated (considering they all own shares of the business) and very knowledgeable. 

I'm a person who likes experience above all and this place will offer that. You can go there with a significant other or a larger group of friends and still have a great time.
 
* i prefer this location to the st-sauveur one.

Must be the best steakhouse in the MTL.  Been here three times.  They cover all the cuts of beef and have lots of seafood as well.  The sides are classic with original touches added in.  Very good wine list and friendly service.  Mrs G and I agreed that the server was one of the best we have on memory.

It is located in the olde city and the ambience is olde style steakhouse.  If a martini (gin and tonic, scotch and water, etc) followed by shellfish, salad, and steak appeals to you, this is a good haunt.

Its been a few years since i visited Canada but this was one amazing restaurant. The steak was out of this world. I mean who really can cook a well done porterhouse without making it a tough piece of meat...Gibbys can. 
Service was top shelf and the mood was lite. 
When you find time and the money GO.

Everything was really good but not super killer. Maybe I expect too much for a bill that is a over a Hundo per person. The food overall was fresh, cooked properly, tasted good. I just feel I've eaten at better steakhouses and the word on the block was I wouldn't be able to find better. None the less the Gibby cut steak was good and cooked perfectly med but had my friends beef Wellington and it was AMAZING!  Oysters, asparagus, twice baked potatoe were good but not great.

Service was great, food was just above average, but nothing impressive...

Great steakhouse with large portions which are perfect to share. The building is beautiful with large historic charm and wood beams everywhere. My husband and I split the filet steak, Monte Carlo potato and a salad. It was a perfect size for two people. Looks like a place that also serves large parties quickly so would be perfect for a family,bachelor/Bachelorette party,etc. Defintely coming back next time we are in Montreal!

This is the restaurant to visit in Montreal when you're a tourist with exchange-rate friendly money to burn. I ate here a few times before I became a vegetarian, and I'd probably go back now that I'm a big meat-eating cheater, because the steaks are excellent, as is the ambiance. It's in a historic building, which the designers incorporated into the restaurant, so it has that old world charm you came to Montreal for in the first place. If you're a local and you're reading this, you probably prefer going elsewhere. Please email me a list of your favorites, because I love your city.

Gibby's, I gather, is something of an institution which means something of a tourist trap, but it's not an overrated, Times Square-esque tourist trap, so I'd say it's worth a visit before you move on to whatever secret hole in the wall your French-speaking cousin wants to drag you to instead.

On a 3-1/2 week vacation through Canada, this was THE BEST MEAL of the entire trip.

My meat was perfect, my potato was perfect, my "adult beverage" was perfect.

I don't know what else to say.  If you enjoy it, if it's delicious, it's a great meal.  Remember, I was on a cruise ship for 3 weeks, famous for good food, and THIS was my favorite meal.

Service was great. The steak was overdone slightly from medium rare, which made it really tough and dry.
Otherwise the Monte Carlo potatoes was great. As was everything else besides the steaks.
Best damn meal in Montreal. Their menu is a little pricey, but the meal is worth it. You will not walk away from here with an empty stomach.

Prima restaurant. Aanbevolen door onze huurbaas en gelijk uitgeprobeerd!
Niet het goedkoopste maar zeker waar voor je geld. 
Zal een goede herinnering aan mij steak overhouden. Heerlijk!

Kom zeker bij een volgende gelegenheid terug.

My steak was cooked to perfection!  Gibby's never fails to disappoint. The last time i was there i shared the Oysters Rockefeller which were really tasty. I ordered the filet mignon which was a good size and perfectly medium rare. The service was really good and the decor made me feel like I was in a nice cabin enjoying a great steak with friends. I don't mind paying the price for a meal this good. I left so full really had no room for dessert at all. Yes it was expensive but sometimes its nice to treat yourself. Major plus is this place is in old Montreal, probably one of the nicest parts of the city with a lot of tourists and close to the water.

Bread...lots and lots of warm delicious Gibby's bread. Gibby's is a Montreal institution. The atmosphere is incredibly unique as the restaurant is in a 200+ year old stone building in old Montreal. It's great bang for the buck, your meal comes with amazing bread, pickles, coleslaw, the signature Gibby's salad and yummy mint chocolates at the end. The steaks are very good and they have an amazing Clam Chowder. The ambiance is a bit dark and the restaurant is huge so there's always room but it never hurts to make a reservation especially on the weekend.

I have entertained business guests at Gibby's thrice and I find this an excellent choice. The place has an old-world charm. And considering what a nightmare parking in downtown Montreal is, the valet parking is a blessing. 
Ambience inside is pleasant. Tables are not packed too tightly, and so it didn't feel cluttered, and is conducive for conversation. Service staff were attentive and cheerful. 
As for food, the steak is outstanding - with a smoky flavour and cooked to perfection. However I have to say that I find the portions too large. My wife chose the petit filet mignon and it turned out to be a better size. The Provence prawns served with garlic butter was equally outstanding. So was the lobster tails. 
The desserts are also of huge portions each. The chocolate cake was memorable even though none of us could finish it. The coffee flambé (Spanish, Irish or Brazil) were wonderful - "performed" (mixed and flambé) there and then by the servers. A dramatic end to top the evening. 
Price of food and wine is on the high side for casual dining. In our case, inclusive of 2 bottles of wine our bill worked our to $100 per person. 
I would still come back for the special occasions.

This place is a classic. It has a cosy old Montreal ambience, very good service, valet parking, a fairly varied menu and prices to match its classic style.  The food is good and portions are generous.

Wow... what a great, friendly restaurant. We hosted a customer dinner for 45 people. The staff was amazing. Took care of everyone and were beyond friendly. The food was delicious, large portions, well cooked steaks. I had the fish and it was yummy. Highly recommend, especially for larger parties.

I started with the French onion soup which was excellent.  it is by far my favorite soup,  and they do a great job with it.  The ribeye was awesome and so was the twice baked potatoe. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Great steak place!
I ordered the snails to start. Fantastic! Not too creamy but had a great flavour!
The. I had the rib steak with salad and Monte Carlo potato. 
The steak was so big! It can be easily shared by two people. I got it medium rare. And it was fantastic! Its seasoning was perfect and the steak itself was juicy and tender. 
The potato was awesome too, must try!
We got the cream puff thing for dessert, it was a nice ending to our meal. 
I also have to mention their excellent service. There was a small portion of lemon sorbet serviced after the appetizer to cleanse your taste buds and get you ready for your main course. And there was a bowl of water served after the main course for you to clean your hands. Sweet!
Anyway, we had a great experience at Gibbys.

A friend told me this place was fantastic and worth the money. Not at all worth it. Cocktails are 12 dollars a piece.  Very crowded and LOUD! We couldnt have a conversation it was so loud. Food was very bland needed tons of salt and pepper. Beef wellington looked so good. Cut like butter, cooked perfectly medium rare and it was like eating tofu. Completly tasteless. Will not go again or recommend. Much better places here for a quarter of the price.

I'd say three stars overall, two if you give much weight to the price. On the plus side, it's in a beautiful building and has a great vibe, and the valet parking is a life-saver for anyone (like us) dumb enough to drive into this neighborhood thinking they'll save time. 

On the minus side, the food ranges from decent, neighborhood restaurant-quality (the steaks and fish) to standard diner-level (the salad and appetizers), to supermarket-level (the bread).  

We were treated to some surreal comedy by a deadpan waitress determined to hard-sell the salad:

"Are you sure you want the gazpacho? We're famous for our salad."
"That sounds nice, but I'm really in the mood for some gazpacho."
"We're FAMOUS for our salad."
"Yeah, I don't know ..."
"And our dressing. You've never had anything like it. We're FAMOUS for our SALAD."

So almost everyone ordered the salad, which turned out to be a big bowl of iceberg lettuce, big wedges of half-flavorful tomatoes, and what tasted an awful lot like Newman's Own Italian dressing. It felt a bit like a Seinfeld episode. 

I was the only one at our table who took a chance on the gazpacho, which, while better than the salad, didn't distinguish itself in any way. It was under-seasoned (it hit the spot after an addition of pepper and the bacon bits they give you to tart up the bread)

The arctic char I had was competently cooked, on the conservative / flaky end of the spectrum, and well seasoned. The ribeye steak I sampled was good quality and perfectly cooked medium-rare, with very little temperature gradient. It didn't taste like it had been dry aged or that it was any special provenance. It would have been an impressive steak at a lower price, but I hope for a little more when the price goes north of $50. 

We had a great time here, but I doubt I'll go back on future Montreal trips. I suspect the city has much better offerings. Gibby's reminds me of many New York City restaurants that have been around forever, and are now mostly famous for being famous. As such they mostly attract tourists (like us) who haven't done enough research.
Unfortunately, I found this place overpriced for the quality of the food I had. There are better steak places that aren't tourist traps!

I like this place , the steak  and lobster are good And I love the deserts also the staff were nice and I love the interior design ! Good place for a romantic dinner for two but  just remember for the price U are paying U would definitely expect more than that but its okay it worth a try at least once

Prior to coming, I read reviews about this place but I was very disappointed leaving here. First, we made a reservation for 2 couples to not be seated with each other and they ended up seating us with each other. 

Pros:
- Decor: I loved the entry to the restaurant. Very cute to take pictures of with your friends or significant other. It has a very rustic vibe to the restaurant. 

Cons: 
- Food: Our clam chowder was not very good. The clams were not fresh and had a different taste to them. We also got the Filet Mignon of Beef Wellington and the beef did not taste so great either. My partner got the Lobster Tails and they did also not taste fresh. 
- Price: For the quality of food I got and the weight of the price, my partner and I were not to happy. 
- Parking: You will probably have to pay for valet here. Unless you leave early and can find parking in the area. Unfortunately, we are from Toronto and did not know the area well. 

Overall, I do not think I will be coming back. As nice as the restaurant is, I was fairly disappointed with the quality of food we, had for the price we paid.

10 stars out of 5!!! Oh my God is this place incredible! My husband and I were in Montreal a few weeks ago for a couple hockey games and we are lucky to have found this gem.  We wanted a delicious steak dinner and we got one. Gibby's has such a great steakhouse feel, the ambiance is perfect and their food is out of this world- even the bread and butter was amazing! We started with shrimp cocktail and the salads that came with dinner- both delicious. I ordered the Filet Mignon and added the Canadian Lobster Tail- absolutely incredible, the best best steak and lobster I have ever had.  My husband felt the same about his dish, he ordered the sirloin steak and loved it.  The waiter was great and service was amazing. This meal and experience was everything and more. We were so thrilled that we found the perfect steakhouse in Old Montreal- will definitely go back next time we are in town!

Gibbys is an old time classic steak house that is definitely one of the best in downtown Montreal and in my mind could be the best consistent restaurant in the old port.  You enter this place and it has a rustic charm feel to it that is both warm and cozy. Like being in an old lodge or tavern. Word has it that is used to be the stables for the horses way way back! 

Onto the menu. There are so many different cuts of beef that even the most difficult curmudgeon will find something to his or her liking. They excel with their peppercorn or mustard sauces on steak. Also there is an excellent selection of fish (salmon, tuna, swordfish, Arctic char) just to name a few. Shrimp and lobster of course. Really a super duper menu! 

On this fine evening I had selected the curry shrimp. I know this is a steakhouse but eating a big morsel of steak at 8:00 pm = a bad nights sleep for me! The curry shrimp came out on a very generous serving on rice with pampadams and asparagus. I found the curry sauce a bit gooey but it had a decent spice and was flavourful and fragrant. One the less! Portion size here is "unbuckle the pants" a bit big! 

We had 18 people in our group and it was one of the best group dinners we've had together! Everyone had a blast!

Our overall experience at Gibbys was good, but over priced.  Orders at our table included the ribeye, the New York strip, and Beef Wellington. All the dishes were in the $50+ range, and while good, did not seem worth the price. What was excellent was the service; our waiter took very good care of us.

I'm planning on another trip to Montreal for the upcoming holiday  and a visIt must include a return to this old school Vieux Monttreal iconic landmark.

A great location, Vieux (old) Montreal takes you to another world and centuries away even though you are only 90 miles from Burlington VT

But let's get back to the food...their steak done perfectly( Rib Eye is a favorite)  ample bread and as I recall fantastic pickles...and all reasonably priced.  We started with a Gibby's house salad and frankly the portions were so ample that  sides were superfluous. They are also known for  seafood if red meat isn't your thing.

The ambience is old school steak house. A bit rustic..The wait staff attentive  and friendly.  In the heart of the most beautiful section of the city.

Full bar...great old school cocktails...a nice wine list.. And the bill with tip was less than you'd expect...certainly the best value for your Canadian Dollar.

I recommend a reservation...and get there early...have a drink upstairs while you wait.

I suggest stay right in Vieux Montreal ... And become a Francophile ...

Vous Aimerez Gibbys!

A quaint building houses one of Canada's best steak houses. Rural old-world charm. Wooden tables, comfortable plush chairs and dimly-lit dining areas give this restaurant a romantic feel.

Reservations weren't difficult to get on a Sunday night when called in the day before, although we were told to come at 8-ish. We were seated promptly when we arrived at 8pm.

The server brought fresh bread, jumbo pickles and a ramekin of bacon crumbles to the table when we sat down. Pickles seems to be a Montreal tradition, but I've never seen bacon served with bread before, but when in Rome! It did add an extra dimension to the bread though.

Appetizers consisted of escargot bourguignonne and mussels provencale. The escargot was excellent, very tender, prepared in the traditional way with garlic, shallots and white wine; served out of the shell in the usual escargot dish. The mussels were baked instead of the more familiar steamed, with tomatoes, herbs and garlic and more bacon!

All entrees include a choice of Gibby's salad or gazpacho and are served with a starch choice of baked potato, Monte Carlo potato or rice pilaf. The Monte Carlo potato is similar to a twice-baked potato with cheese and chives. Asparagus was also included.

We ordered the filet and the petit filet. The regular filet was massive. I would guess a good 14-16 ounces. The petite had to be at least 10. They are on the expensive side, but given the size and the included salad, starch and vegetable it worked out to be good value for money. The steaks were tender and cooked to the correct temperature and the Montreal style seasoning (pepper, onion, garlic) made them delicious.

We rounded off the meal with a shared triple chocolate dessert, which was delightful. We passed on the offer of table-side flaming coffees ($14ea), but the table next to us did order, so we got to see the show.

Service was good, but the server would often disappear for extended periods of time between courses. The tobacco smell emanating from her clothing told us where she had been....

Great food and great service. 

Had Christmas dinner here. Everything we tried was well prepared and delicious. The beef wellington and snail starter were standout dishes.

Everything super salty, to the point where it's unbearable to eat. The staff are nice but nothing beyond. The two waitresses kept chatting and starring at us the whole night, a bit uncomfortable I would say. Not the place I would dream to come back to. Nice and cosy atmosphere though.

The best steakhouse in Montreal hands down. I got a medium rare filet mignon steak it was amazing! Tbh you don't need to order anything else besides a main dish! They give so much extra food besides the main! I had a house salad which was amazing with they're croutons. They also serve amazing bread with this cottage cheese dip and amazing pickles reminded me of Home!  With the steak I ordered the mashed potatoes it was so creamy and good .My boyfriend had a steak with a bone and it was the best marbleized steak with so much flavor pouring out of it. I really recommend gibbys for any occasion. They're vibe and food is over the top!!!!

Gibby's makes me LOVE the meat! My husband likes coming here, and on his latest business trip I had a chance to join him. The restaurant is located in the Old Port of Montreal, and the historic building is about 200 years old. Once inside you feel you've been transported to a different era. Anything you order is of the highest quality, including the desserts; and although the prices are high, you are paying for what you get: an overall excellent experience.

This place is as quaint as it's food is delicious. It is very cozy and the tables are plentiful but to stacked on top of one another.  

Our server was peasant and efficient. The food was stupendous starting with a eel made bourbon old fashioned.  The gazpacho has a nice balanced and fresh flavor.  The sod was crisp, cold and topped with a flavorful garlic vinaigrette. The filet was perfectly cooked to medium. The baked potato was just the right combo of flavors to set it apart from a regular baked.  

The chocolate dessert was a slice of sinful richness. 

Such an awesome spot to try while visiting this awesome city.

Me and my boyfriend were walking around the old port and we craved for steak. We had a friend who recommended this place to us. When we got seated we were served bread, a bowl of pickles and some bacon bits and butter. The bread was amazing! I even asked them for another one. We ordered the crab cakes and oysters to start. Both plates were really delicious. It's probably the best crab cakes I've had. Oysters were also very fresh and not fishy tasting. For our main, my boyfriend had the steak with the bone in it and I had the teriyaki steak. Each of our mains we got to chose a side, he chose a potato and I got the rice. The mains were also served with a salad and soup. My teriyaki steak was delicious, perfectly seasoned and went really well with the rice. My boyfriends steak was cooked to perfection medium rare and also deliciously seasoned. He also got a side order of the mushroom steak sauce which was delicious. The soup and salad that our mains came with we weren't a big fan of. It was a cold soup which was not to my taste and the salad I found was a bit bland but those are given to any mains. I liked how they served us lemon sorbet in between appetizers and main meal to get rid of the taste and also customized Gibby mint chocolate slices at the end of our meal. The service was excellent and we were well looked after, they always checked to make sure we had everything we needed as well as bring out our mains on time after we had finish our appetizers. The next time I  go, I am looking forward to trying their clam chowder soup and I will be ordering my teriyaki steak again. For dessert we shared the creme Brule. It was delicious and creamy, only complaint is we wish they had burned the sugar more as it wasn't burned enough which was lacking. The sugar on top of the creme brule was barely burnt and it was almost as if it wasn't burned at all.. but This restaurant is delicious and deserves a lot more than 5 stars. The bill for 2 of us was around $250. We got 2 appetizers, 2 mains and 1 dessert.

This is a classic steakhouse in old Montreal. I'd not been to Montreal in bout 5 years. The weather was miserable (cold, rain/snow mix) & the parking was difficult but we endured!! I had a 6oz Petite Filet. The reason I gave them a 5* is because they nailed the steak!! It was done precisely the way I wanted it cooked. The Monte Carlo potato which was indescribable delicious. One more thing....the giant garlic dills are wicked. So thick..almost a meal in itself.

Waiter Jan smoothed the way through Gibby's offerings - a succulent black cod for me and the rare (spot on) and tender ribeye for my wife Jan (no relation - smile) - wines were finely paired thanks to Jan's counsel and delight was elegantly achieved.

Had an amazing dinner here for my friends Bachelor Party. Arrived with a big group and was treated to excellent food at great price! Our waiters, Tammy and M-Claude, were awesome and super accommodative to our large group

I went to Gibbys on a Thursday night. This was my first time there, I had read great reviews about the place and with the price I was expecting amazing steak. Unfortunately, i was slightly disappointed. Honestly, almost everything was great. Nice ambiance, free valet, staff was attentive and outstanding  with there service. They start you off with in house bread (very tasty) pickles. When you order a main plate, salad and potatoes come with it. Salad was very good, nice light dressing, Monte Carlo baked potato was out of this world. The ribeye was very delicious however my beef wellington was not that great. 

I was watching master chef and Gordon Ramsey was showing how to make beef wellington and it looked so good. So I searched Montreal restaurants and found that Gibbys had this item on their menu. But I was let down, first I had asked for Medium cook but the brought Medium rare. I asked them to cook it more. Once they brought it back, the meat was not seasoned at all and was kinda tough. I did not enjoyed it at all.

I am still giving it a 4 star as everything else was excellent. But I do not recommend the beef wellington
Great food and service at this Montreal treasure! Located in old Montreal, this spot had a vast menu and provides a great dining experience from start to finish.

Amazing dinner. I came here with my husband to celebrate his birthday while in Montreal, based on a colleague's recommendation. I loved everything about this place! The ambience is very nice and romantic. Looks kind of cave like inside. The servers and hosts were very friendly. To start, they give you a fresh loaf of bread with butter and pickles. Yum! Our entrees came with a salad which was delicious as well. We ordered the filet mignon and rib steak. Both were accompanied by Monte Carlo (which is a baked potato twice baked with bacon, sour cream, and chives) and asparagus. I was soooo full before the entree but HAD to finish the Monte Carlo because it was Soo good. I would totally recommend anyone in Montreal to come here for a good steak dinner! Free valet parking too!

We were in Montreal for 7 days and ate here 2 of them - that's how good it is.  It reminds me of an old style chop house with wait staff in formal looking clothing, tableside preparation and a big menu. Service was good although a little slow at times but it's a huge place and the staff were doing all they could.  One nice thing is that there isn't a "it's not my table" philosophy - if a staff member is near you they will check in to see if you need anything.  We didn't pack dressy clothing and felt perfectly comfortable in slacks and nice shirts.

 I've read some of the negative reviews on here and my response to them is check out the menu before you go.  If they serve something you like you will be very pleased, if it's not what you're looking for, go somewhere else but don't blame it on the restaurant.

En famille super bon, huîtres, moules puis filet buf et homard excellente expérience. 
Service ok et agréable.

Wow! If you are ready to spend a little extra on a good dinner, go to Gibby's. House made pickles had my girlfriend almost full before we even started on dinner and the pretzel roll had me smiling. We ordered drinks, wine for her and a cocktail for me. Both were pleasing and mine was particularly strong. Dinner was Filet Mignon Wellington for me and I don't think it could have been better. A light flaky crust quickly have way to an expertly prepared steak. My girlfriend ordered the rib eye and it was just slightly over done (we still enjoyed about 80% of it). Dessert was perhaps the best I have ever had. Crepe filled with vanilla ice cream and topped with blueberries and raspberries had me full to bursting! The experience was capped with mints and was $20 less than we planned for. Highly recommended!

Out of the nice steakhouse's that I've been to in Montreal, this is the best in my opinion.

Moishe's is expensive, but it has no atmosphere and the steak is unacceptably inconsistent for the price.  Gibby's has a great atmosphere, with a full restaurant that makes you feel all warm and fuzzy inside with the low ceilings .

The food is consistent and worth the bigger price tag.  Servers are friendly and attentive, fulfilling the expectations that you usually bring to a place like this.

They also have great seafood options if you're not in the mood for beef (or lamb, etc.).
Good, traditional steak house... Good choice for a business meeting, but there are better choices for a nice night out.

Our visit to Gibby's last evening was simply mahvelous!  After a few opening cocktails, I had Gibby's salad along with a veal chop and the Monte Carlo potato. Ended the meal with Key Lime pie. The setting was cozy, the service was great and the food was delicious. Wonderful steakhouse.
Wow! Simply the best steakhouse I've been to in a while. The rack of lamb was perfectly cooked and my appetizer was fantastic.

Excellent service but it could be that we got lucky with the waiter who was sooooo wonderful!!  We only came here based on the very good overall reviews but to be honest, my steak was eh.  I've had the top of the top steaks before so I know these cuts weren't that good.  I mean, it wasn't altogether terrible but i did expect better. 
We ordered the rib eye and Gibby's cut.  

I am giving a high rating because our waiter was fantastic to us.  The wine was excellent.  I enjoyed the sorbet.  At the end, our waiter gave us dark chocolate that we all liked.  

The place had a lot of tourists, which is nice.  The decor was rustic.  The waitstaff in the front was a little stoic to me... meaning, there wasn't a welcoming greeting nor even an attempt to be welcoming.  Weird huh?  Like I said, the best part was that our waiter was sincere and really nice.  Forgot his name but our table was all the way in the back.. so maybe you can ask for that area for seating? hehe.

One of the most recommended sides was the monte carlo loaded baked potato. that can be shared.  I also had the escargot, YUM!  

Reservations must be made in advance.

We reserved a table here for my birthday, unfortunately I cannot review the food as we did not stay to eat, the restaurant was busy, so we went upstairs to the bar to wait for our table, the wait staff in the bar pretty much ignored us, eventually we were served, our drinks order was wrong twice, so third time lucky, every other table was given snacks, not us, not that we wanted to spoil our appetite, but to be offered rather than ignored, would have been nice, after 45 mins, no updates, many other arriving later being seated first, we paid for our drinks and left. Never again, they trade on a name made 25+ years ago, along with the decor, which has never been updated or cleaned since opening.
Great meal! We were told by everyone we asked to try Gibby's. They were all right. Food was wonderful as was the service. A definite must if you're in Montreal.

I took this recommendation from a local patron at La Casa de Habano, and glad I did. 

The huge stone building appears to have been a stable, or at least it has a courtyard for carriages.

Try the Beef Wellington. It is excellent, tender and the mushroom sauce is the bomb. It's enough for two if you are having salad and dessert. 

Get a reservation. This place stays busy all the time. It's a Montreal favorite for dinner and celebrations!

Our favorite steakhouse on the planet! We make the  drive from Long Island every year, and while our list of restaurants to hit changes, Gibbys is always a staple.  It sounds funny but their pickles are damn good and served at every table with butter and bacon bits.  We got the grab cake appetizer and it was great! Had an aioli sauce with it.  The steak is just unbelievable.  I got the filet medium rare and it was cooked perfectly.  The atmosphere is really cool too.  Can't wait to go again next year.
The place was nice, cozy.. and busy! Service was great and the food came excellent. the portions were very good, as I still had room for desserts. Overall nice environment
Great atmosphere, amazing food, really great service. Trip to Montreal is not complete without Gibby's. Their potions are generous and it was worth every penny! Will definitely go back.

Over the top quality, great service. 
This is a must in old Montreal. It is old but what great ambiance.
The calm chowder is a must, one of the best you will ever have. Beef Wellington is fantastic, my wife had the halibut and it was perfect as well.
In Montreal do not pass up Gibbys

Love this place.  The food is consistent, the service is amazing.  You can dress up or go casual, and there's no judgement.  yes it is a little pricey, but it is a steakhouse in old port montreal; at least you get great food,and a lot of it ( we always have leftovers or order 2 appetizers and 1 main if we are two;for example)

We decided to come here after reading all of the reviews and wanting to go somewhere very good for our last night in Montreal. 

From the outside the building looks quiet and small, but once we walked in we were surprised to see that it was not only full, but a very large restaurant. The dining room has a homey feel to it, like it's a popular local mom-and-pop place. 

The service was excellent and we really enjoyed the complementary bread, butter, bacon pieces, and pickles. The pickles were especially good - very vinegary and salty. Drinks were also great, and so was the French onion soup, although it was sweeter than I like. Portion sizes are huge here, so don't get carried away like we did. I thought the salad that came with dinner would be a normal side salad size, but it was huge - almost a meal in itself. The steak was great and cooked perfectly, and the swordfish came with a Cajun seasoning that was pretty spicy and good.
