We didn't have any room for dessert and left very happy (and with leftovers). While paying the bill I talked to the waitress and she explained that almost everything is made in-house, including desserts, pickles, and bread.

Definitely worth a stop, especially if you're very hungry.

My goodness. Great service and the food was great as well. I had the chicken which was stuffed with butter and onions. They started us with salads then a little sherbet to cleanse the pallet. The entire came then the dessert. Cheese cake was heavenly.

I came here with a group of four hungry gentlemen. We left full and happy. The service was what you'd expect from a good old-school steakhouse: knowledgeable, but not warm and fuzzy, and that's fine. 

I ordered the Gibby Cut and added some shrimp to make it a surf and turf. It was amazing, and the local seasoning they added made it even better. The sides were good as well.

As for the decor, it can be best described as a mix between an old tavern and an old lodge. 

This place is awesome.
Great place!  Awesome atmosphere.  Had the attic chard it was fantastic!  Well worth the visit.

My hotel concierge recommended this restaurant, and it was late already so I didn't do too much investigating into it before I just sat down at a table. It's a very cozy, rustic Montreal steakhouse. The service was very good. The menu had mostly steak and fish options for entrees. Escargot and onion soup were good. Dinner was also good, just not fantastic. I felt it was over priced. I prefer trendier, more creative menus, so I think this place just wasn't for me as a tourist.

Don't get what the hype is about.  First time there for me.  The place just has an old fashioned feel to it (not in a good way), the waitresses' uniforms are ridiculous (what's with the frills?) and the prices are outrageous.  Is the food good, it's a steak.. and it's cooked the way you ask for it to be cooked.  Is this something outstanding?  No- it's a steak restaurant - it's what I would expect.  There is really nothing exceptional about this place, and the prices are high.  Was it good, yes, was it great... it was steak...  would I go back?  Definitely no.

Gibby's deserves all the five-star ratings it gets on Yelp. It really is the perfect place for any special occasion. I went to Gibby's a couple months back to celebrate my birthday. Although it's a little more upscale, the staff is still welcoming and friendly. It's nice to be in a place where it seems like most guests are enjoying a special night out. 

1. Bread & pickles - The bread is amazingly soft and warm. The pickles are little too salty and (dare I say) I might prefer the ones at Moishe's. 

2. Oysters - Deliiiicious. Very fresh and a fresh start to a steak dinner. 

*Citrus sorbet as palette cleanser

3. Filet mignon with baked potato - Very tender and meaty. Cooked to our expectation 

4. Beef wellington with Monte Carlo potato - The pastry was flaky and the beef was extraordinarily tender. Really nice mushroom sauce. The potato was so creamy and satisfying. Ended up taking half of the portion home and it still tasted delicious the next day. 

No room for dessert but will have to go back another time!

Gibby's should definitely be on your list if you're a meat lover. And if you're looking for a full-blown meat experience, you won't leave disappointed, as the menu offers a wide range of steaks, cuts, and even more finest dishes such as fish, chicken, seafood, etc.

Gibby's is stacked in a 200-year-old building, which gives to the restaurant all its charm and ambiance. Magnificent and stunning. 

I had nature oysters as the appetizer. They were absolutely delectable. These were followed by the Gibby's salad and the Petite filet mignon, very rare AKA blue. One word to remember here : tender. 

To top it off, I added to the whole experience the Gibby's layered chocolate cake. Dinner couldn't have been better without it. Simply delicious and special. 

Only thing that could be improved is their wine list. Since I'm a wine lover, I love to pair good and funky wine to my delicious dish. Sad that their "exhaustive wine list" isn't that exhaustive. I wish they could add more private importation bottles and also by the glass.

Service was lovely, professional and fast. The waitress gave me nice recommendations.

By far the worst restaurant we have been to, we travel a lot and visit many restaurants, but this takes the trophy of worst steak, and service. 
We ordered 3 steaks and some shrimp and a bottle of wine. 
The steaks were over cooked the first time so we didn't get to taste them. Then they came back and they tasted like low quality oily steak. The shrimp tasted like one big garlic, the server was no where to be found so we had to get up and find croutons, napkin, and silver ware. 
Oh and to top off our night they spilled steak bloody sauce all over our white $4000 leather jacket and shirt.
The nastiest restaurant, and worst steak in our life! They said they would clean the jacket; but they didn't follow through, and even then white leather doesn't clean that  well when the stain is blood and steak sauce!!!

These boys know how to grill a steak - perfect temp on the inside and seared to carmelized perfection on the outside. And I take my steaks rare thank you very much. The boneless rib eye was off-the-charts mouthwatering good; almost melting in the mouth. And what a service team; everyone pitched in to help regardless of what needed to be done. All of our orders arrived at precisely the right moments - just enough time to fully savor the previous course before the next arrived. Dining out has been elevated to an art form and that form is Gibby's.
Brilliant steak house...brilliant service..great pickles and bread to start!!!! Love old Montreal and this place is not to be missed...highly recommended!
Amazing.  Spent a week in Montreal and luckily found this place.  Best salad, yellowfin tuna, twice baked potato and ambience I experienced by a long shot in the city.

Went here for business meal in mid December and the place was packed.  We were able to get a table for 6 but quarters were tight.  There were some very energetic and interesting waiters & waitresses but, ours was soft spoken but attentive.  

Gibby's is in a 200 year old building with a rich history ... tall people need to be very careful. The historic building and old world charm of the restaurant really makes you feel like you're in a different time.  But, the menu prices brought me right back to 2015 (a strong US dollar helped make it reasonable).  

The food lives up to the reputation as a high end chop house.  We all had steaks of some kind and everyone enjoyed.  Starting with the fresh baked bread that keeps getting replace with a full loaf and the famous Gibby's salad - which comes with anchovies and is similar Caesar.  Both were delicious.  

I had the Beef Wellington rare.  My first time trying this dish and it was terrific.  They use a filet cut that was so fresh, it actually came across as almost tasteless.  The mushroom & pastry coating were great. But, the mushroom gravy was amazing.  If it was appropriate, I would have drank some straight from the gravy boat.  

Bottom line is that Gibby's is a high end restaurant in a historic part of old Montreal.  It's a fancy place and you pay "fancy prices."  But, the food is very good & worth the money. And, the atmosphere is worth a visit for a special occasion

We traveled from Dallas to visit Montreal and chose Gibby's for my husband's birthday dinner. I don't think we could chosen a more perfect place. 

The service, from everyone was incredible. I even messed up our reservation time, and the team worked us in quickly and with a smile. 

And if the service was a 10 out of 10, the food was a 15 out of 10! Everything from appetizer to dessert: perfection. 

I highly recommend a visit for all ages!

While I'm not the biggest fan of steak I love some good seafood so when the chance arose to go to Gibby's I said why not.  Situated in Old Montreal the restaurant is housed in an old stable and offers a warm and cozy ambiance.  It also has complimentary valet parking which is good to note since parking in the area can be next to impossible sometimes. 

The portions here are HUGE so I opted to skip the appetizer.  Besides you also get a starter included with your meal (salad, tomatoes and onions or tomato gazpacho).  I opted for the gazpacho which despite being tomato based was loaded with lots of other vegetables such as green peppers which really upped the flavour of the dish.  Be warned though that there is lots of garlic in the gazpacho so it is not the best choice if you're there for date night!

I opted to have the lobster tails as my main with a Monte Carlo potato on the side.  The Monte Carlo is a baked potato with sour cream, bacon and chives and it is definitely a cut above a normal baked potato.  The lobster just fell apart and when dipped in butter was like a little taste of heaven.

I finished off with blueberry cheesecake for dessert and the texture was just right.  Also it didn't taste too rich.  The waiter also brought mint chocolates at this point too which was a nice way to finish off a good meal.

The service was pretty good except for a couple of minor errors where they brought us the wrong items.  That being said they did correct the mistake quickly.  In the end it was a good meal but given the prices here it's the kind of place where you come to celebrate a special occasion.

First time visitor.  Just arrived to montreal with my wife from toronto.  We've been looking forward to the food here for quite some time.  

We were incredibly impressed with everything tonight.  

The atmosphere is excellent.  The portions are generous and more importantly tasty.  We really appreciated the mid meal lemon sorbet to cleanse the pallet and the minty dark chocolate at the end of the meal. 

The steak was a bit on the garlicky side but we agreed to the extra topping.  Will definitely be coming back!

Had high hopes. Lots of children and grandparents, people in very casual wear. Hotel made the reservation, yet we were still seated next to a bussing station. Good for tourists and families with small children, but if you are two adults wanting a nice meal, check Yelp for other suggestions.

Always great. Been coming here for years and they've always been perfect. The service is professional. The food is exquisite and fresh. Their homemade bread, pickles and bacon are wonderful starters. This time I had the NY sirloin and it was perfectly cooked. Will continue making it my favorite steakhouse.

Gibby's est une institution et la qualité ne bronche pas. Tout est bon! La qualité des produits est incontestable. Je craque pour: la soupe à l'oignon, sûrement la meilleure que je n'aie mangée; le carré d'agneau; les fruits de mer; les pommes de terre Monte Carlo et le profiterole! Rien à dire de plus. J'adoooore!!!

Great location . . . former stable in Old Montreal.  Lone Star food for Morton's  prices.  Diner-level service.  No visible management.  They scrape the dirty dishes in the dining room . . . where they serve $50 steaks, really?  Popular tourist restaurant, but overstated.  Average restaurant in a great restaurant city.

Food was delicious, but service was really bad. Wanted to have a nice dinner for my bf's bday. We waited in the lounge for 30 mins, they never came to see us to serve us drinks. There's no bar to go up to order, there was only 2 waiters and they are walking by so fast not even looking. We order, at this point it's been an hour and we are hungry, brings bread no butter for another 15 mins. Wont go again, possibly bad timing, but for the amount I paid, i expected at least service while i was waiting in the lounge.

Very very nice in every way. Recommended to us by a former resident of Montreal, and glad she did. Met friends for dinner and both the food and the service was spot on. The ceilings are very low but somehow it doesn't detract from the ambiance. No hesitation on the 5 star rating.

In the heart of Old Montreal, off Rue Youville. Previous 18th Century Stable house. Three floors with a mix of modern/contemporary decor. Wood on inside with big fireplace. Stonewalls covered with beautiful vines on the outside. Patio closed today due to down pour of rain. Quite the fine dining experience! Service was on par with knowledgeable staff. Bathrooms located on top floor where there is a lounge or the bottom floor where there is rooms for lager group events. Knowing for their Rib-eye and strake- also has a seafood option. We started off with Fresh baked bread with creamy butter and large dill pickle. Your choice of wine or cocktail. Next can the Appetizers and ended up getting the regular green salad and others tomato /onion. Portions were not small- so pace yourself and be prepared to eat. I got the Steak of Dianne with an amazing gravy glaze that cannot be explained with worlds. Meat was cooked to preference. Came with rice/ veggies and lobster tail. Others ordered 1/2lb of lobster which looked and tasted like it came fresh from the sea that day! They gave us lemon glacé to cleanse our palate between meals and then when we thought it could be enough- there was dessert. Known for their chocolate moist cake and featured key lime pie. Choice of coffee or after dinner drinks. We were so full - we had to sit for a bit longer in which staff did not mind they were quite friendly and entertaining. One ordered the chocolate bourbon latte and there's was a cool "fireshow" to go with it. Our waiter did not disappoint. Can buy local sauces and dill pickle in jars of u so choose. Good thing about location- you could and would have to walk back to digest all that's eaten! They do have taxis that can drop off and have valet parking.

I've been here a few times but last week I went two nights in a row. Thursday I went with my colleagues. I started with the Gibby's salad, the rib eye steak and the Monte Carlo potato followed by the blueberry cheesecake. The steak was ok but the cheesecake was very good! It's not too sweet and it's pretty big and filling!

On Friday, one friend n I had the beef wellington with the Monte Carlo potato. The first time I had it, it blew my mind!! The pastry was crispy and the inside was nice and tender! It was perfection! Since then it honestly hasn't been as good at it was the first time but it is still my favorite thing on the menu. However that night, the waitress gave my friend a beef wellington cooked medium-well, which was not what she had asked for but when she cut it it was actually more on the medium rare side which was what she wanted. Whereas I asked for medium rare and it looked more rare than medium rare. We still ate it and it was still tender but it wasn't cooked the way we wanted it. Our friend had the rack of lamb. It was breaded and very tasty. We let them know in advance that it was our friend's birthday and they provided a whole vanilla cake for free. They also took a polaroid of the group and they gave it to us...it's a nice little souvenir. 

The service on Friday wasn't as good as the service on Thursday. In general I did notice that the service is a lot better during the week when there are less people, which I guess makes sense. For example, it took awhile for the waiter to fill our glasses of water on Friday and we had to refill our own wine glasses but on Thursday our glasses of water and wine were always filled. One time I went and the waiter was so nice and gave me extra bacon for my leftovers and extra chocolate mints to bring home which I really appreciated. Normally I really enjoy the service here. 

Gibby's is good but I wouldn't say it is the best steakhouse in Montreal.

Always a great place to eat. The steaks are especially good.  Make sure you get a reservation well in advance.  Very good wine list.  The pickles are always a hit.  Sadly the service is up and down.  We are batting about .500 right now, and it is getting close to us branching out to other places.  The owners need to make all of the servers understand that folks are dropping some good money and expect the human experience to be as the food.

The hotel concierge recommended to visit Gibby 's , so we went..
Located in the historical building in old town Montreal Gibby's wasn't that good as we expected it to be
The service was average , we waited for our food 40-50 minutes((
The food was pricy but average

I was in Montreal for work and my coworkers and I decided to go here because of the reviews. 

Honestly, I thought this place was overrated and over priced. I love steakhouses, but I was utterly disappointed with the flavor and taste of it. It was a little lackluster.

Foodwise, I ordered the French Onion soup which was okay. I've had way better. The top was too burnt and for an onion soup, the flavor wasn't there. It was just okay. My coworker and I split the Canadian lobster tail and the Gibbys ribeye steak to try the best of both worlds. So, portions were massive! For the price you are paying, I sure hope so. The lobster was good. It was cooked well, the butter sauce was good and I had the double baked potato which I think was the best thing I ate out of everything. The steak was a great piece, but as I've mentioned, the flavor didn't really hit me. I was expecting more, especially with all the great reviews from others - but I was disappointed.

The ambiance was pretty cool. It's a busy place so expect to be there for a couple of hours. We were there probably for 4. 

If you want an over priced, average steak, this is the place for you.

For the price, you can do much better in Montreal.  The place is stuffy, especially in the basement, the service is very inattentive, clueless at times and the waiter had little manners (Sniffles?  Blowing your nose?  Come on!).  You do get the feeling you're in a steak factory.

The prices are absolutely scandalous.  Expect to pay SAQx3 from the wine card.  The food itself is very good but you can get a comparable meal elsewhere.  We had the filet mignon and it was delicious.  The monte-carlo potato was top notch.

After dropping north of $230 for two, I will definitely never go back.

This was a pretty good steak place... buuut since America is probably the steak capitol of the world  - I was kind of dissapointed.

I think ruth's chris does a better steak yeah? Had both the rib eye and the wellington. Not bad. 

But for the price....

It's definitely one of the  nicer (pricier) restaurants in the area though. So if you are looking for that...

After so many years Gibbys is still one of the best steakhouses in North America . I was there today with my wife we really enjoyed the food ,except on e little thing :) ok restaurant has 2 sections upstairs and downstairs , I never been downstairs before , ok it's nice but it was soooooo cold :))) constant cold air flowing from outside  they have to fix the heating system . Other then that? Nope no complains

Excellent meal all around and perfect service. The French onion soup was excellent and the table pickles and bacon were very fun and new to us. The bread was awesome and the food was great. We really enjoyed it very much.

Only 4 stars because one of our steaks was overcooked, but they made it up to us by comping a dessert which was very nice of them.

I really loved this restaurant - one of my top picks in the city, and I loved every meal. We started with a variety of appetizers - jalapeno-stuffed sausage, smoked salmon, mussels, olives - they were amazing. I could have eaten the mussels as my meal, they were so delicious.

The service was also stellar and the wine fantastic. We ordered the sirloin cruste and petite fliet. Both were fabulous and the sides were also delicious.

I can't imagine how anyone could give this restaurant a poor rating. The service was stellar, food and drink were superb and it was such a neat location. Highly recommended overall.

Good old fashioned steakhouse. If you're feeling nostalgic, then this place is for you.  It's trendy, with all the perks of an old world restaurant :)
Steak and sides are very good. Salad is amazing.
It's on the expensive side... So maybe best kept for special occasions.

Warm bread and pickles

Gazpacho
A hint of spice. Delightful
Onion/spice after taste but not too strong.

Lemon sorbet (palate cleanser)
Worked really well because my mouth had a lot of aftertaste of onion left.

Monte Carlo
This came with our main. It was really good! And it came on a medium/large sized potato.

Rib Steak (Gibbys cut)
To be honest, I was kind of disappointed by the steak. There was too much gristle and the steak was rare, not medium rare.
But the other experience superseded the disappointment (even though I was looking very much forward to the steak). The sauce that came with it went really well with the steak though.
Side note: The portions here are huge and the cost performance is great. It might've just my cut that was bad.

Side dish of lobster tail
They tasted really good. Especially when you dip it in the garlic butter that comes with it.

My friends got the Beef Wellington, Salmon, and Mignons of Beef Diane, and they loved it! I've tasted them and they were better than my steak.

Service was on point. Our waiter was Sebastien. He filled our water very regularly, and he was very helpful with food/drink suggestions.

Overall, I would definitely come back again. :)

Two words: clam chowder. The BEST I've ever had and I've been from east to west of Canada with no restaurant that can compare to here!! It is so rich and not too filling, with so much hearty meat (seafood ofc), seasoned so perfectly! My mouth is watering just remembering back to it. 

For the steaks - they are HUGE. Keep in mind, they don't mention the size (oz) of the steaks on the menu so I did not expect the big portions at all. My boyfriend ordered the Ribeye Gibby's cut which turned out to be 19oz, WITHOUT the bone. I ordered the NY Sirloin which was 16oz!!! Perfectly cooked to our preference and oh-so juicy. We were both wow-ed by our first bites. 

For the sides, we both got the Gibbys salad which was okay. The monte carlo potatoes on the other hand - definitely a treat if you want something more savoury than regular baked potatoes. It was recommended to us by our waitress and it did not disappoint. 

I really wish I had room for dessert, because that menu looked pretty good too. But with the shared clam chowder & a steak each, my boyfriend and I had some leftovers and were beyond stuffed. 

The service is amazing too - free valet, seated right away without a reservation and our waitress really took her time to go through the menu with us. 1 star taken off my rating because the restaurant was more than half empty yet the host sat us down right beside the workers station. So it was a teeny bit annoying trying to enjoy the ambiance when workers are constantly coming to the wall behind our table to wait around, dump their dishes or prepare their settings. Other than that, the food was amazing so will definitely be coming back.
This place has great steak. and French Onion Soup...the service was a bit spotty.

Was in Montreal with friends and decided to go after reading reviews. I liked the food. Not the most amazing food ever but I gave it a 5 because the service is amazing which makes the food taste better. I would def go back.

One of my favourite places in Montreal,  especially for out of towners.  A fancy restaurant without any pretention. If you want a Jewish steakhouse in Montreal this is it.

The prices are high but include sides with your meal, unlike most steakhouses.  Choose the monte carlo potato, don't hesitate.  The Gibby's salad and the tomato salad are both good choices. Dont forget to add croutons and bacon.  The pickles and especially the bread put out on the table are delicious. Mouth currently watering for that slightly sweet and freshly warm bread.  I always used to get the crusted lamb.  The beef Wellington is amazing.  I recommend the fresh blueberry cheesecake for dessert.

A great choice for an occasion where you want to feel special.

Gibbys was recommended to us by others who have eaten here on their trips to Montréal. Gibbys is located in the beautiful, rustic neighborhood of "Old Montréal." As soon as you walk in you feel like you're in a different era, a colonial era. Even the servers wear uniforms that remind you of simpler times.

Gibbys is open for dinner service and it's highly recommended you make a reservation. We were the first guests in the building for our reservation, but not even an hour later almost all the dining rooms were full and they were on a decent wait. There is a nice, large waiting area upstairs where there are many couches, seats, etc. The restrooms are also located by the waiting area upstairs and to my surprise it was a gorgeous, clean restroom (strange observation, I know, but too many places these days don't take care of their facilities).

Dinner service starts with bread, homemade pickles and fresh bacon bits. I didn't know what to do so I just ate the pickles and scooped some bacon bits in with the mixture. Their pickles are DELICIOUS. They are giant, whole pickles with lots of flavor and crunch. I started with the French Onion soup and wasn't impressed. Soup was very sweet and didn't have a whole lot of flavor. I'm more of a salty French Onion person, but that's just me.

For dinner I had the escargot. Escargot was delicious, but I was surprised it didn't come with toast or bread of some sort to dip in the oil. My Mom enjoyed her salmon and said it was perfect. It did look great and the vegetables accompanying the dish were just the right "al dente" style so I would say salmon there is a safe choice if you're looking for a fish dish. My fiancé had the filet and loved it as well. It was cooked to the temperature of his liking. 

I guess for the money I would expect presentation to be more than it was. None of the dishes had that "WOW" look to them. Taste is always more important than presentation, but sometimes presentation can deceive the mind into thinking the food tastes better, or vice versa.

I do want to note that the service was SPECTACULAR and we made sure our server knew it. She made our experience memorable. We were here celebrating my fiancé's birthday and she came out with a birthday cake (not sure if it was complimentary as I did not see the receipt) that said "Happy Birthday Ryan!" and was enough to feed 6-8 people, if not more. The cake was light and not too rich, with some lovely fruit in the mixture. We all loved it. They also take your picture and then at the end of the meal come out with a Gibbys paper frame with the picture inside! It's such a unique touch and we greatly appreciated the gifts. Everyone from our server to the hosts to the reservationist and management were extremely friendly and welcoming.

I would say this place is so popular because of the nostalgia feel it gives the folks of Montréal who have been dining here since they were children. The food was just OK to me. I'm glad I tried it, but don't know if I would go back.

This place is fantastic! A gorgeous converted barn in old Montreal, the atmosphere is very friendly and warm. Food and service were great, up there with some of the best I've had. The table had rack of lamb, the Gibby's rib steak, and a chicken Kiev. All portions were huge so be warned! The quality was superb and all were perfectly cooked. An extensive wine list makes it easy to find something to suit your pallet and budget.

When asking the hotel concierge what was the best steakhouse in town, they said Gibby's. After securing a reservation for us, we took an Uber and we were so excited from the moment we saw the charming restaurant. The stone building held the traditions of a great restaurant. 

The menu is full of choices but it seemed clear to us to get the additional lobster tails with our steak which based on pictures on Yelp and our server, it was good enough for 2 people. The steak was a little more well done than the medium rare we ordered but it was good nonetheless. The lobster was tender and came on top of rice which we did not order but accompanied the lobster well. The baked potato with all the fixins already blended together in the potato is worth trying. 

It was my birthday and it was so sweet when our server took a picture of me and gave it to me in a Gibby's picture holder. I will not forget this delicious celebratory meal in such a historic atmosphere, friendly staff and wonderful food.

It's a birthday occasion for our gathering and I have to say that everything we ordered was better than expected.
Not only the food is fantastic, the ambient and service were one of the best we have ever experienced.
Will highly recommend to all our friends and family~
Will definitely come back to explore more dishes on their menu~

Gibby's is old school and great.  The menu is full of classics like a New York or Steak Diane.  The building is classic Old Montreal, big old stone barn, free valet parking and a big dining room (only wished they had a patio).  

Get the Monte Carlo (twice baked) Potato, loved the Gibby's salad, fresh bread and the bowl of sour pickles.  The steaks were huge and the fish was fantastic.  I had the Rare Tuna and someone else had the Salmon.  Ask the server for suggestions, she had tons of ideas.  Treat yourself to a classic dining room experience.  I thought it was well priced, it's not cheap, but worth every cent.  Highly recommend.
Had the rib steak. Classic steakhouse with good services. All around great food and reasonable pricing. Location  is great

This was the finishing touch to an outstanding culinary experience in Montreal!  This is an exceptional steakhouse with great food and a very classy atmosphere.  

We had a group of colleagues and everyone was very satisfied.  I started with the house salad which was simple but very good and went with the Gibby's cut for my entree.  This was such a flavorful steak and was cooked perfectly.  Per a recommendation from a colleague, I opted for the monte carlo potato to accompany the steak - I can honestly say this was the best riff on a twice baked potato I have ever had.  You have to try it!!!

For desert, we shared the profiteroles and also had the Brazilian coffee.  Both were great and the preparation of the coffee was a show to watch!

Our service was top notch throughout this great meal - was very happy to have visited and recommend everyone gives this a shot if they're looking for some great food and an even better experience!

A famous restaurant in old Montreal which I have been many many times. Its become a tradition in our family that we come here on birthdays so today was my daughters turn. 
I must say that normally service here is just OK but tonight it was excellent and made a point on my way out telling management about it.
I had Gibby's cut Rib eye steak. With an onion soup to start. Both excellent. Although I found that the steak was a little tough it was still good.
I found that it was a nice added touch they gave a free bday cake and took a picture and gave it to us in a nice Gibby's card. Classy!!!!
We will continue to go back.....

Gibby's is by far one of my favorite steakhouses/seafood restaurants in Montreal!

Tucked away on a quiet street in Old Montreal, this restaurant proves itself time and time again with topnotch service and unbelievably prepared dishes! Free valet parking also makes this restaurant a great choice for those cold winter nights.

As per price, most people might consider Gibby's a little on the pricier side, but I've been to many steakhouses in North America, and Gibby's is a little bit more moderately priced than some others.

I highly recommend the filet mignon, to which you can add on an order of jumbo shrimp grilled in garlic butter if you're a surf and turf lover like me, or I also recommend the 2lb lobster, which can be served grilled or boiled.

They have a wide selection of other cuts of meat, seafood, and chicken.

All main courses come with a choice from two or three appetizers, but you should definitely go with the "Gibby's salad," and you also get a choice of potato -- baked, mashed, fries, or double baked. Double baked is commonly referred to as a Monte Carlo potato, and that's always the one I choose!
I came in from Texas not expecting much, but I was pleasantly surprised at the high quality steak and atmosphere.  This place was highly recommended by everyone I talked to in Montreal.

Ok, so it's an old fashioned experience and ambiance.
We came for my husbands birthday.
 
He ordered the ribeye and loaded baked potato. He liked it but has had much better.
I ordered the petit fillet, medium. It came medium well and chewy. My baked potato was undercooked. Really.
The best part of the meal was the birthday cake.
Expensive and nothing to rave about.
Food was great! Met a gentleman from Egypt  who works as a hostess  was so lovely . Food was ok.

How can you not like a great steak especially when its in this very cool rustic stone building which is over 200 years old. Apparently this is a tough place to get reservations at but I had no problem calling that morning and reserving a Saturday night dinner at 8pm for 4 people. When we got there we only waited around 15 minutes for our table to open up and considering how packed it was I was pretty happy with that. We sat down and and had 4 completely different dinners all of which are cooked just right and tasted delicious. I had the prime rib, my friends had the rib eye, lamb and some other meal which I have forgotten, but I tried it, and I will vouch for whatever it is that he had. The drinks were a served a little bit different from what we were used to. Now its hard to tell if its a Canada thing or if this restaurant just made it a little different. That hardly takes away from the meal though as there was enough food that we were all satisfied. If we werent going out that night t party after, we would have finished off the food and been stuck in food coma till the next morning...but then again, thats usually what a hearty steak dinner can do to you anyways. Since I dont live in Montreal and its kind of a trip to get there Id love to sample other restaurants before I go back but you better believe I will be telling all of my friends who visit to check out Gibbys.

This iconic restaurant in the old port is a must when visiting Montreal. Opened two years after the first Gibby's (1972) in St Sauveur (1970) this place will definitely win you over if you're looking for a steakhouse.

I've only been here once many years ago and remembered having a really fun evening. This time around was to celebrate my mom's birthday. We were a group of 16. Some came late, other had way too many questions and demands. You know, the annoying ones ;). The waitresses were more then nice and patient. No complaints about the service here. Everything was great!

The wine list was ok. It has too many American wines and certainly not enough wines from France (they only had red Bordeaux). Menu is pretty straight forward and there is no extra fee for sharing the plates! Now THAT i love!!! Our meats were cooked to perfection. The only thing that i didn't like was the watery/wilted salad. I think they dressed it too early. Portions are huge! Free pickles! Free bread and free real bacon bits. 

I don't think i could afford eating here every week but can certainly come back when craving a great steak!

Really cool place... You can see and feel the history in Gibby's interior, but it's not just for tourists. Many locals eat here regularly, and it's easy to see why.

The food and service are fantastic, and it's both an experience and a consistently great meal when you come here. They also offer a very nice wine list, and heavenly desserts

Recommended

I was torn between rating Gibby's a 4 or a 5, but Shannon, our server, deserves it to be a 5.  Before I go into any other detail, I need to make sure you all know  the service is hands down some of the best we have had. Drinks were never close to being empty throughout our 2 hour meal.

The food is phenomenal--from the appetizers to the meals. We had the shrimp cocktail, French onion soup, Gibby's salads (yum! Where can I get that dressing in the US), a Gibby's cut ribeye and a petite filet Mignon. Both steaks were cooked perfectly. I was jealous of my husband's steak because he got the garlic butter/herbs on his, but mine was fabulous, too. The Monte Carlo potatoes are also delicious! I wish we had room for dessert--the apple crisp that was going by looked to die for.

The only downfall to our dinner was that we were seated in the basement area, and it was extremely loud. I know Gibby's is located in a city, and I know the majority of loud parties were Americans (like myself) enjoying a night out in Montreal, so I can overlook the small let down. Just be forewarned if you're looking for a romantic dinner, this may not be the ideal place to go on a Saturday night.
It is a very nice traditional Steakhouse in Montreal. Food, service and the atmosphere of restaurant are so impressive. Especially Wellington Steak and Rib Steak are delicious! Love this place!

They refill your water. 
The steak is out of this world! I would recommend the teriyaki shish kabab or the filet mignon. Medium well was good for me. The Malbec wine by the bottle is also a good bet. 
Do not fill up on bread before you get your meal because the portions are sizable! Service is great. 
You can't eat outside, only have a drink. 
The crowd is older. But who cares cuz the food is so good! 
They give you mint chocolate at the end!
Don't forget to make a reservation.
Service was excellent.  Atmosphere is cozy, feels like a lodge.  Food was decent, but no creativity and definitely not exciting food.  Check out my blog for more!

We had Christmas dinner at Gibby's, and experienced some lapses in service during our time there. 

The food was generally good. The grilled Arctic char and gibby's cut of steak were cooked well and pretty delicious. The Monte Carlo potato and the chocolate delight was yummy too! Portions were humongous. However, the escargot, Gibby's salad, gazpacho and creamed spinach were so-so and could be skipped. The wine we ordered was not bad, but we later discovered it was priced at least 3x the average commercial price for the bottle. 

The ambiance was also generally good. We were not rushed and were able to have good conversations and sufficient privacy. 

In terms of service, my friend who ordered the lamb rack got her order delivered wrong twice. Once it was overcooked to the point of being difficult to separate, the next time it was delivered almost blue inside. While our waitress was courteous and did all she could, including offering a complimentary dessert for this, these mess-ups at the kitchen side still delayed our dinner considerably and made it awkward for my friend who felt bad returning the food, and who either felt compelled to finish her meal fast or sit awkwardly without her dish while waiting for a replacement. 

We also experienced an incident at coatcheck, with a friend's gloves and metro card falling out of her pocket during the time. Luckily she realised her gloves were gone before we left and returned for it. The coat check lady clearly knew that the gloves had fallen out of someone's pocket as she was able to quickly retrieve the gloves from the front desk, but she had not proactively displayed the gloves or asked if anyone had lost their gloves. 

My friend only realised her metro card was also missing when we reached the metro station after a grueling walk in the ice and snow.
